Account-level rules apply to all zones within the account that do not have their own zone-level rules overriding them.

Properties AccessRules Gets the API for managing account-level IP Access Rules. public IAccountAccessRulesApi AccessRules { get; } Property Value IAccountAccessRulesApi Remarks Corresponds to the /accounts/{account_id}/firewall/access_rules/rules endpoint. Buckets Gets the API for managing R2 buckets and related resources. public IR2BucketsApi Buckets { get; } Property Value IR2BucketsApi Remarks Provides operations for bucket CRUD, CORS, lifecycle, custom domains, managed domains, bucket locks, Sippy migration, and temporary credentials. D1 Gets the API for managing D1 serverless SQL databases. public ID1Api D1 { get; } Property Value ID1Api Remarks Corresponds to the `/accounts/{account_id}/d1/database` endpoint family. D1 is Cloudflare's native serverless SQL database built on SQLite. The REST API is subject to global Cloudflare API rate limits and is best suited for administrative operations. For high-throughput query access, consider using a Worker with D1 bindings. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/ https://developers.cloudflare.com/d1/ Kv Gets the API for managing Workers KV namespaces and key-value pairs. public IKvApi Kv { get; } Property Value IKvApi Remarks Corresponds to the /accounts/{account_id}/storage/kv/namespaces endpoint family. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/kv/ Rulesets Gets the API for managing account-level Rulesets (e.g., WAF Custom Rules). public IAccountRulesetsApi Rulesets { get; } Property Value IAccountRulesetsApi Remarks Corresponds to the /accounts/{account_id}/rulesets endpoint family. api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets.IR2B.title: Interface IR2BucketsApi | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets.IR2B.summary: Interface IR2BucketsApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for interacting with Cloudflare R2 bucket resources. This API provides operations for managing R2 buckets including creation, deletion, listing, CORS configuration, lifecycle policies, custom domains, managed domains, bucket locks, and Sippy (incremental migration) configuration. public interface IR2BucketsApi Remarks Jurisdictional Buckets: Buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion) require the jurisdiction parameter on all bucket-specific operations. See R2Jurisdiction for details. Methods AttachCustomDomainAsync(string, string, string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Attaches a custom domain to an R2 bucket, allowing it to be served from a custom hostname. Task<CustomDomainResponse> AttachCustomDomainAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, string zoneId, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to attach (e.g., "files.example.com"). zoneId string The ID of the zone the hostname belongs to. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CustomDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the CustomDomainResponse from the API. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/domains/ CreateAsync(string, R2LocationHint?, R2Jurisdiction?, R2StorageClass?, CancellationToken) Creates a new R2 bucket within the configured account with optional location and storage settings. Task<R2Bucket> CreateAsync(string bucketName, R2LocationHint? locationHint = null, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, R2StorageClass? storageClass = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The desired name for the new bucket. Must be 3-64 characters and unique. locationHint R2LocationHint? Optional location hint suggesting where the bucket's data should be stored. Use R2LocationHint constants (e.g., EastNorthAmerica). jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Optional jurisdictional restriction guaranteeing data residency. Use R2Jurisdiction constants (e.g., EuropeanUnion). storageClass R2StorageClass? Optional default storage class for new objects. Task SetCorsAsync(string bucketName, BucketCorsPolicy corsPolicy, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. corsPolicy BucketCorsPolicy The CORS policy to apply to the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. Task SetLifecycleAsync(string bucketName, BucketLifecyclePolicy lifecyclePolicy, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. lifecyclePolicy BucketLifecyclePolicy The lifecycle policy to apply to the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. Remarks Lifecycle rules can perform the following actions: Delete objects after a specified age or on a specific date Abort incomplete multipart uploads after a specified age Transition objects to Infrequent Access storage class Rules are processed within 24 hours of being set. Maximum of 1000 rules per bucket. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/lifecycle/methods/update/ SetLockAsync(string, BucketLockPolicy, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Sets or updates the lock rules for an R2 bucket. Task<BucketLockPolicy> SetLockAsync(string bucketName, BucketLockPolicy lockPolicy, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. lockPolicy BucketLockPolicy The lock policy to apply to the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketLockPolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketLockPolicy with the applied lock rules. Remarks Lock rules can have the following condition types: Age-based: Retention for a specific duration in seconds Date-based: Retention until a specific date Indefinite: Permanent locking without expiration Maximum of 1000 lock rules per bucket configuration. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/r2/buckets/bucket-locks/ UpdateAsync(string, R2StorageClass, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Updates properties of an existing R2 bucket. Task<R2Bucket> UpdateAsync(string bucketName, R2StorageClass storageClass, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket to update (3-64 characters). storageClass R2StorageClass The new default storage class for newly uploaded objects. This does not change the storage class of existing objects. Use R2StorageClass constants (e.g., InfrequentAccess). jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Bucket> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the updated R2Bucket with the bucket's properties, including the new StorageClass. Remarks Currently, the only property that can be updated is the default storage class for new objects. Existing objects in the bucket retain their original storage class; use lifecycle rules to transition them if needed. The bucket's location hint and jurisdiction cannot be changed after creation. Task<CustomDomainResponse> UpdateCustomDomainAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, UpdateCustomDomainRequest request, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to update. request UpdateCustomDomainRequest The update request with new domain settings. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CustomDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the CustomDomainResponse with the updated configuration. Returns Task<R2Bucket> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the R2Bucket with the bucket's properties, including its Jurisdiction. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/methods/get/ GetCorsAsync(string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Gets the CORS policy for an R2 bucket. public Task<BucketCorsPolicy> GetCorsAsync(string bucketName, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketCorsPolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketCorsPolicy with the current CORS rules. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/cors/methods/get/ GetCustomDomainStatusAsync(string, string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Gets the current status of a custom domain attached to a bucket, including ownership and SSL status. public Task<CustomDomainResponse> GetCustomDomainStatusAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to check. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CustomDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the CustomDomainResponse with the latest status. GetLifecycleAsync(string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Gets the lifecycle policy for an R2 bucket. public Task<BucketLifecyclePolicy> GetLifecycleAsync(string bucketName, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketLifecyclePolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketLifecyclePolicy with the current lifecycle rules. Remarks Lifecycle rules determine object retention, automatic deletion, storage class transitions, and cleanup of incomplete multipart uploads. A bucket can have up to 1000 lifecycle rules. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/lifecycle/methods/get/ GetLockAsync(string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Gets the lock rules for an R2 bucket. public Task<BucketLockPolicy> GetLockAsync(string bucketName, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketLockPolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketLockPolicy with the current lock rules. Remarks Bucket locks prevent the deletion and overwriting of objects for a specified period or indefinitely. If multiple rules apply to the same prefix or object key, the strictest retention requirement takes precedence. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/r2/buckets/bucket-locks/ GetManagedDomainAsync(string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Gets the current state of public access over the bucket's R2-managed (r2.dev) domain. public Task<ManagedDomainResponse> GetManagedDomainAsync(string bucketName, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<ManagedDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the ManagedDomainResponse with the r2.dev domain status. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/domains/ GetSippyAsync(string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Gets the Sippy (incremental migration) configuration for an R2 bucket. public Task<SippyConfig> GetSippyAsync(string bucketName, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<SippyConfig> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the SippyConfig with the current Sippy configuration. Remarks Sippy is an incremental migration service that copies data from cloud storage providers (AWS S3, GCS) to R2 as it's requested, helping avoid upfront egress fees during migration. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/r2/data-migration/sippy/ ListAllAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters?, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Lists all R2 buckets in the account, automatically handling cursor-based pagination. public IAsyncEnumerable<R2Bucket> ListAllAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters? filters = null, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListR2BucketsFilters Optional filters for pagination. The cursor will be ignored. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Optional filter to return only buckets in this jurisdiction. When null, returns all buckets regardless of jurisdiction. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<R2Bucket> An asynchronous stream of all R2 buckets in the account. ListAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters?, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Lists R2 buckets in the account, allowing for manual pagination control. public Task<CursorPaginatedResult<R2Bucket>> ListAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters? filters = null, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListR2BucketsFilters Optional filters for pagination. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Optional filter to return only buckets in this jurisdiction. When null, returns all buckets regardless of jurisdiction. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CursorPaginatedResult<R2Bucket>> A single page of R2 buckets along with pagination information. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/methods/list/ ListCustomDomainsAsync(string, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Lists all custom domains attached to an R2 bucket. public Task<IReadOnlyList<CustomDomain>> ListCustomDomainsAsync(string bucketName, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyList<CustomDomain>> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a list of CustomDomain objects representing all custom domains for the bucket. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/domains/ SetCorsAsync(string, BucketCorsPolicy, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Sets or updates the CORS policy for an R2 bucket. public Task SetCorsAsync(string bucketName, BucketCorsPolicy corsPolicy, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. corsPolicy BucketCorsPolicy The CORS policy to apply to the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/cors/methods/update/ SetLifecycleAsync(string, BucketLifecyclePolicy, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Sets or updates the lifecycle policy for an R2 bucket. public Task SetLifecycleAsync(string bucketName, BucketLifecyclePolicy lifecyclePolicy, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. lifecyclePolicy BucketLifecyclePolicy The lifecycle policy to apply to the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. Remarks Lifecycle rules can perform the following actions: Delete objects after a specified age or on a specific date Abort incomplete multipart uploads after a specified age Transition objects to Infrequent Access storage class Rules are processed within 24 hours of being set. Maximum of 1000 rules per bucket. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/lifecycle/methods/update/ SetLockAsync(string, BucketLockPolicy, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Sets or updates the lock rules for an R2 bucket. public Task<BucketLockPolicy> SetLockAsync(string bucketName, BucketLockPolicy lockPolicy, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. lockPolicy BucketLockPolicy The lock policy to apply to the bucket. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketLockPolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketLockPolicy with the applied lock rules. Remarks Lock rules can have the following condition types: Age-based: Retention for a specific duration in seconds Date-based: Retention until a specific date Indefinite: Permanent locking without expiration Maximum of 1000 lock rules per bucket configuration. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/r2/buckets/bucket-locks/ UpdateAsync(string, R2StorageClass, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Updates properties of an existing R2 bucket. public Task<R2Bucket> UpdateAsync(string bucketName, R2StorageClass storageClass, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket to update (3-64 characters). storageClass R2StorageClass The new default storage class for newly uploaded objects. This does not change the storage class of existing objects. Use R2StorageClass constants (e.g., InfrequentAccess). jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Bucket> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the updated R2Bucket with the bucket's properties, including the new StorageClass. Remarks Currently, the only property that can be updated is the default storage class for new objects. Existing objects in the bucket retain their original storage class; use lifecycle rules to transition them if needed. The bucket's location hint and jurisdiction cannot be changed after creation. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/methods/edit/ UpdateCustomDomainAsync(string, string, UpdateCustomDomainRequest, R2Jurisdiction?, CancellationToken) Updates the configuration of a custom domain attached to a bucket. public Task<CustomDomainResponse> UpdateCustomDomainAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, UpdateCustomDomainRequest request, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to update. request UpdateCustomDomainRequest The update request with new domain settings. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Required for jurisdictional buckets created with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CustomDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the CustomDomainResponse with the updated configuration.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Buckets Classes R2BucketsApi Implements the API for managing Cloudflare R2 bucket resources. Interfaces IR2BucketsApi Defines the contract for interacting with Cloudflare R2 bucket resources. This API provides operations for managing R2 buckets including creation, deletion, listing, CORS configuration, lifecycle policies, custom domains, managed domains, bucket locks, and Sippy (incremental migration) configuration.

D1 is Cloudflare's native serverless SQL database built on SQLite. All operations are account-scoped, using the account ID from configuration. The REST API is subject to global Cloudflare API rate limits and is best suited for administrative operations. For high-throughput query access outside Workers, consider creating a proxy Worker with D1 Worker bindings. Returns Task<D1ImportResponse> Import response with bookmark for polling. Optional region hint for database placement. jurisdiction D1Jurisdiction? Optional jurisdictional restriction (overrides location hint). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1Database> The created database. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/create/ DeleteAsync(string, CancellationToken) Deletes a D1 database. public Task DeleteAsync(string databaseId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID to delete. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task Remarks This permanently deletes the database and all its data. The operation cannot be undone. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/delete/ GetAsync(string, CancellationToken) Gets a specific D1 database by ID. public Task<D1Database> GetAsync(string databaseId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1Database> The database details. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/get/ ListAllAsync(ListD1DatabasesFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all D1 databases, automatically handling pagination. public IAsyncEnumerable<D1Database> ListAllAsync(ListD1DatabasesFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListD1DatabasesFilters Optional filters for name search. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<D1Database> An async enumerable of all databases. Remarks The D1 API returns total_count=0 and total_pages=0 in the pagination info, which is inconsistent with the standard Cloudflare API schema. To work around this limitation, this implementation checks if the current page is full (item count equals PerPage) to determine if there are more pages. Returns Task<IReadOnlyList<D1QueryResult<TRow>>> Typed query results with metadata. Type Parameters TRow The type to deserialize each row into. QueryRawAsync(string, string, IReadOnlyList<object?>?, CancellationToken) Executes a SQL query and returns results as arrays (raw format). public Task<IReadOnlyList<D1RawQueryResult>> QueryRawAsync(string databaseId, string sql, IReadOnlyList<object?>? @params = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. sql string The SQL statement to execute. params IReadOnlyList<object> Optional parameter values for parameterized queries. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyList<D1RawQueryResult>> Raw query results with rows as arrays. Remarks The raw endpoint returns rows as arrays instead of objects, which is more efficient for large result sets. Column order matches the SELECT clause order. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/raw/ StartExportAsync(string, D1ExportDumpOptions?, CancellationToken) Initiates an export of the database to SQL format. public Task<D1ExportResponse> StartExportAsync(string databaseId, D1ExportDumpOptions? dumpOptions = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. dumpOptions D1ExportDumpOptions Optional filtering options (schema only, data only, specific tables). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1ExportResponse> Initial export response with bookmark for polling. Remarks Export is an async operation that requires polling. Call PollExportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) with the returned bookmark until status is "complete". The database is unavailable for queries during export. Exports that aren't polled will auto-cancel. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/export/ StartImportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Initiates an import operation by requesting an upload URL. public Task<D1ImportResponse> StartImportAsync(string databaseId, string etag, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. etag string MD5 hash of the SQL file content. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1ImportResponse> Response containing upload_url and filename for SQL file upload. Remarks Import workflow: Compute MD5 hash of your SQL file Call StartImportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) with the hash to get upload URL and filename PUT your SQL file to the upload_url (verify ETag matches) Call CompleteImportAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) with etag and filename to start ingestion Poll with PollImportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) until status is "complete" The database is blocked during import operations. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/import/ UpdateAsync(string, UpdateD1DatabaseOptions, CancellationToken) Updates a D1 database's configuration. public Task<D1Database> UpdateAsync(string databaseId, UpdateD1DatabaseOptions options, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. options UpdateD1DatabaseOptions The update options (e.g., read replication settings). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1Database> The updated database. Remarks Use this to enable/disable read replication by setting ReadReplication.Mode to "auto" or "disabled". See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/update/

API Limits (Workers Paid plan): Max databases: 50,000 per account Max database size: 10 GB Max account storage: 1 TB Max SQL statement length: 100 KB Max query duration: 30 seconds Max bound parameters: 100 per query Max row/string/BLOB size: 2 MB Max columns per table: 100 Important: D1's REST API is best suited for administrative use as the global Cloudflare API rate limit applies. For high-throughput query access outside Workers, consider creating a proxy Worker with the D1 Worker binding. QueryRawAsync(string, string, IReadOnlyList<object?>?, CancellationToken) Executes a SQL query and returns results as arrays (raw format). Task<IReadOnlyList<D1RawQueryResult>> QueryRawAsync(string databaseId, string sql, IReadOnlyList<object?>? @params = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. sql string The SQL statement to execute. params IReadOnlyList<object> Optional parameter values for parameterized queries. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyList<D1RawQueryResult>> Raw query results with rows as arrays. Remarks The raw endpoint returns rows as arrays instead of objects, which is more efficient for large result sets. Column order matches the SELECT clause order. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/raw/ StartExportAsync(string, D1ExportDumpOptions?, CancellationToken) Initiates an export of the database to SQL format. Task<D1ExportResponse> StartExportAsync(string databaseId, D1ExportDumpOptions? dumpOptions = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. dumpOptions D1ExportDumpOptions Optional filtering options (schema only, data only, specific tables). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1ExportResponse> Initial export response with bookmark for polling. Remarks Export is an async operation that requires polling. Call PollExportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) with the returned bookmark until status is "complete". The database is unavailable for queries during export. Exports that aren't polled will auto-cancel. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/export/ StartImportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Initiates an import operation by requesting an upload URL. Task<D1ImportResponse> StartImportAsync(string databaseId, string etag, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. etag string MD5 hash of the SQL file content. cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1ImportResponse> Response containing upload_url and filename for SQL file upload. Remarks Import workflow: Compute MD5 hash of your SQL file Call StartImportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) with the hash to get upload URL and filename PUT your SQL file to the upload_url (verify ETag matches) Call CompleteImportAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) with etag and filename to start ingestion Poll with PollImportAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) until status is "complete" The database is blocked during import operations. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/import/ UpdateAsync(string, UpdateD1DatabaseOptions, CancellationToken) Updates a D1 database's configuration. Task<D1Database> UpdateAsync(string databaseId, UpdateD1DatabaseOptions options, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters databaseId string The database UUID. options UpdateD1DatabaseOptions The update options (e.g., read replication settings). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<D1Database> The updated database. Remarks Use this to enable/disable read replication by setting ReadReplication.Mode to "auto" or "disabled". See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/subresources/database/methods/update/ See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/d1/ https://developers.cloudflare.com/d1/platform/limits/

api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.D1.Models.D1.summary: Struct D1Jurisdiction Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.D1.Models Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Represents a jurisdictional restriction for D1 database data storage. Jurisdictions provide a guarantee that data stored in the database will remain within a specific geographic or regulatory boundary. Unlike location hints, jurisdictions are enforced constraints. [JsonConverter(typeof(ExtensibleEnumConverter<D1Jurisdiction>))] public readonly struct D1Jurisdiction : IExtensibleEnum<D1Jurisdiction>, IEquatable<D1Jurisdiction> Implements IExtensibleEnum<D1Jurisdiction> IEquatable<D1Jurisdiction> Inherited Members object.Equals(object, object) object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks This is an extensible enum that provides IntelliSense for known values while allowing custom values for new jurisdictions that may be added to the Cloudflare API in the future. When creating a D1 database with a jurisdiction, the primary_location_hint parameter is ignored. The jurisdiction takes precedence and guarantees data residency within the specified region. The FedRamp jurisdiction requires Enterprise customer status. Contact your Cloudflare account team for access. Constructors D1Jurisdiction(string) Creates a new D1Jurisdiction with the specified value. public D1Jurisdiction(string value) Parameters value string The string value representing the jurisdiction. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when value is null. Properties EuropeanUnion European Union jurisdiction. public static D1Jurisdiction EuropeanUnion { get; } Property Value D1Jurisdiction Remarks Data is guaranteed to be stored within the European Union, helping meet GDPR and other EU data residency requirements. FedRamp FedRAMP jurisdiction. public static D1Jurisdiction FedRamp { get; } Property Value D1Jurisdiction Remarks Data is stored in compliance with FedRAMP (Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program) requirements for U.S. federal government data. This jurisdiction requires Enterprise customer status. Contact your Cloudflare account team or Cloudflare Support for access. Structs D1Jurisdiction Represents a jurisdictional restriction for D1 database data storage. api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.IAccountsApi.title: Interface IAccountsApi | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.IAccountsApi.summary: Interface IAccountsApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for interacting with Cloudflare Account resources. This includes managing R2 buckets and their associated domains, as well as account-level security resources like IP Access Rules and WAF Rulesets. public interface IAccountsApi Properties AccessRules Gets the API for managing account-level IP Access Rules. IAccountAccessRulesApi AccessRules { get; } Property Value IAccountAccessRulesApi Remarks Corresponds to the /accounts/{account_id}/firewall/access_rules/rules endpoint. Buckets Gets the API for managing R2 buckets and related resources. IR2BucketsApi Buckets { get; } Property Value IR2BucketsApi Remarks Provides operations for bucket CRUD, CORS, lifecycle, custom domains, managed domains, bucket locks, Sippy migration, and temporary credentials. D1 Gets the API for managing D1 serverless SQL databases. ID1Api D1 { get; } Property Value ID1Api Remarks Corresponds to the `/accounts/{account_id}/d1/database` endpoint family. D1 is Cloudflare's native serverless SQL database built on SQLite. The REST API is subject to global Cloudflare API rate limits and is best suited for administrative operations. For high-throughput query access, consider using a Worker with D1 bindings. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/d1/ https://developers.cloudflare.com/d1/ Kv Gets the API for managing Workers KV namespaces and key-value pairs. IKvApi Kv { get; } Property Value IKvApi Remarks Corresponds to the /accounts/{account_id}/storage/kv/namespaces endpoint family. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/kv/ Rulesets Gets the API for managing account-level Rulesets (e.g., WAF Custom Rules). IAccountRulesetsApi Rulesets { get; } Property Value IAccountRulesetsApi Remarks Corresponds to the /accounts/{account_id}/rulesets endpoint family. Methods AttachCustomDomainAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) Attaches a custom domain to an R2 bucket, allowing it to be served from a custom hostname. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.AttachCustomDomainAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task<CustomDomainResponse> AttachCustomDomainAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, string zoneId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to attach (e.g., "files.example.com"). zoneId string The ID of the zone the hostname belongs to. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CustomDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the CustomDomainResponse from the API. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/domains/ CreateAccountAsync(CreateAccountRequest, CancellationToken) Creates a new Cloudflare account. Note: This operation is only available to tenant administrators. Standard users will receive a permission error. Task<Account> CreateAccountAsync(CreateAccountRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters request CreateAccountRequest The account creation parameters. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<Account> The newly created account. Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. This endpoint requires tenant admin privileges. Most users should use the Cloudflare dashboard to create accounts. Exceptions CloudflareApiException Thrown when the user lacks tenant admin privileges or the request is invalid. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/accounts/methods/create/ CreateR2BucketAsync(string, R2LocationHint?, R2Jurisdiction?, R2StorageClass?, CancellationToken) Creates a new R2 bucket within the configured account with optional location and storage settings. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.CreateAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task<R2Bucket> CreateR2BucketAsync(string bucketName, R2LocationHint? locationHint = null, R2Jurisdiction? jurisdiction = null, R2StorageClass? storageClass = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The desired name for the new bucket. Must be unique. locationHint R2LocationHint? Optional location hint suggesting where the bucket's data should be stored. Use R2LocationHint constants (e.g., EastNorthAmerica). jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction? Optional jurisdictional restriction guaranteeing data residency. Use R2Jurisdiction constants (e.g., EuropeanUnion). storageClass R2StorageClass? Optional default storage class for new objects. Use R2StorageClass constants (e.g., InfrequentAccess). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Bucket> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the R2Bucket from the Cloudflare API, detailing the created bucket. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/methods/create/ DeleteAccountAsync(string, CancellationToken) Permanently deletes an account and all associated resources. Warning: This is a destructive operation that cannot be undone. All zones, Workers, R2 buckets, and other resources under the account will be permanently deleted. Note: This operation is only available to tenant administrators. Task<DeleteAccountResult> DeleteAccountAsync(string accountId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DeleteAccountResult> The deletion result containing the deleted account's ID. Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. This endpoint requires tenant admin privileges. The operation is permanent and will remove all zones and resources under the account. Exceptions CloudflareApiException Thrown when the user lacks tenant admin privileges. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/accounts/methods/delete/ DeleteBucketCorsAsync(string, CancellationToken) Deletes the CORS policy for an R2 bucket, removing all CORS rules. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.DeleteCorsAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task DeleteBucketCorsAsync(string bucketName, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/cors/methods/delete/ DeleteBucketLifecycleAsync(string, CancellationToken) Deletes the lifecycle policy for an R2 bucket, removing all lifecycle rules. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.DeleteLifecycleAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task DeleteBucketLifecycleAsync(string bucketName, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. Remarks Cloudflare R2 does not have a dedicated DELETE endpoint for lifecycle policies. This method removes the policy by setting an empty rules array. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/r2/buckets/object-lifecycles/ DeleteR2BucketAsync(string, CancellationToken) Deletes an R2 bucket. The bucket must be empty before it can be deleted. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.DeleteAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task DeleteR2BucketAsync(string bucketName, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket to delete. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. DetachCustomDomainAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Detaches a custom domain from an R2 bucket. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.DetachCustomDomainAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task DetachCustomDomainAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to detach. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. DisableDevUrlAsync(string, CancellationToken) Disables the public r2.dev URL for a given bucket. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.DisableManagedDomainAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task DisableDevUrlAsync(string bucketName, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket to modify. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. GetAccountAsync(string, CancellationToken) Gets details for a specific account. Returns the full account object including settings and managed_by information. Task<Account> GetAccountAsync(string accountId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier (32 hexadecimal characters). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<Account> The account details. Examples var account = await client.Accounts.GetAccountAsync(accountId); Console.WriteLine($"Account: {account.Name}"); Console.WriteLine($"2FA Enforced: {account.Settings?.EnforceTwofactor}"); See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/accounts/methods/get/ GetBucketCorsAsync(string, CancellationToken) Gets the CORS policy for an R2 bucket. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.GetCorsAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task<BucketCorsPolicy> GetBucketCorsAsync(string bucketName, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketCorsPolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketCorsPolicy with the current CORS rules. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/cors/methods/get/ GetBucketLifecycleAsync(string, CancellationToken) Gets the lifecycle policy for an R2 bucket. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.GetLifecycleAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task<BucketLifecyclePolicy> GetBucketLifecycleAsync(string bucketName, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BucketLifecyclePolicy> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the BucketLifecyclePolicy with the current lifecycle rules. Remarks Lifecycle rules determine object retention, automatic deletion, storage class transitions, and cleanup of incomplete multipart uploads. A bucket can have up to 1000 lifecycle rules. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/lifecycle/methods/get/ GetCustomDomainStatusAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Gets the current status of a custom domain attached to a bucket, including ownership and SSL status. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.GetCustomDomainStatusAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task<CustomDomainResponse> GetCustomDomainStatusAsync(string bucketName, string hostname, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the R2 bucket. hostname string The custom hostname to check. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CustomDomainResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the CustomDomainResponse with the latest status. ListAccountsAsync(ListAccountsFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all accounts the authenticated user has access to. Returns a single page of results with pagination information for manual pagination control. Task<PagePaginatedResult<Account>> ListAccountsAsync(ListAccountsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListAccountsFilters Optional filtering and pagination options. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<PagePaginatedResult<Account>> A page of accounts with pagination information. Examples var accounts = await client.Accounts.ListAccountsAsync( new ListAccountsFilters(PerPage: 50)); foreach (var account in accounts.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{account.Name} ({account.Type})"); } See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/accounts/methods/list/ ListAllAccountsAsync(ListAccountsFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all accounts the authenticated user has access to, automatically handling pagination. This method returns an IAsyncEnumerable<T> that automatically fetches additional pages as you iterate, yielding all accounts without manual pagination handling. IAsyncEnumerable<Account> ListAllAccountsAsync(ListAccountsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListAccountsFilters Optional filtering options. Pagination parameters (Page) are ignored. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<Account> An async enumerable of all accessible accounts. Examples await foreach (var account in client.Accounts.ListAllAccountsAsync()) { Console.WriteLine($"{account.Id}: {account.Name}"); } See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/accounts/methods/list/ ListAllR2BucketsAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all R2 buckets in the account, automatically handling cursor-based pagination. This method will be removed in a future version.")] IAsyncEnumerable<R2Bucket> ListAllR2BucketsAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListR2BucketsFilters Optional filters for pagination. The cursor will be ignored. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<R2Bucket> An asynchronous stream of all R2 buckets in the account. ListR2BucketsAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists R2 buckets in the account, allowing for manual pagination control. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.ListAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task<CursorPaginatedResult<R2Bucket>> ListR2BucketsAsync(ListR2BucketsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters filters ListR2BucketsFilters Optional filters for pagination. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<CursorPaginatedResult<R2Bucket>> A single page of R2 buckets along with pagination information. SetBucketCorsAsync(string, BucketCorsPolicy, CancellationToken) Sets or updates the CORS policy for an R2 bucket. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.SetCorsAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task SetBucketCorsAsync(string bucketName, BucketCorsPolicy corsPolicy, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. corsPolicy BucketCorsPolicy The CORS policy to apply to the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/cors/methods/update/ SetBucketLifecycleAsync(string, BucketLifecyclePolicy, CancellationToken) Sets or updates the lifecycle policy for an R2 bucket. [Obsolete("Use Buckets.SetLifecycleAsync instead. This method will be removed in a future version.")] Task SetBucketLifecycleAsync(string bucketName, BucketLifecyclePolicy lifecyclePolicy, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket. lifecyclePolicy BucketLifecyclePolicy The lifecycle policy to apply to the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task that represents the asynchronous operation. Remarks Lifecycle rules can perform the following actions: Delete objects after a specified age or on a specific date Abort incomplete multipart uploads after a specified age Transition objects to Infrequent Access storage class Rules are processed within 24 hours of being set. Maximum of 1000 rules per bucket. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/r2/subresources/buckets/subresources/lifecycle/methods/update/ UpdateAccountAsync(string, UpdateAccountRequest, CancellationToken) Updates an existing account's name and/or settings. Returns Task<Account> The updated account. api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Kv.IKvApi.ht.title: Interface IKvApi | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Kv.IKvApi.ht.summary: Interface IKvApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Kv Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Provides access to Cloudflare Workers KV operations. Workers KV is a global, low-latency key-value data store. public interface IKvApi Remarks All operations are account-scoped. The account ID is configured via AccountId. API Limits: Key name max length: 512 bytes Value max size: 25 MiB Metadata max size: 1024 bytes (serialized JSON) Minimum TTL: 60 seconds Write rate limit: 1 per second per key Methods BulkDeleteAsync(string, IEnumerable<string>, CancellationToken) Deletes multiple keys in a single request. Task<KvBulkDeleteResult> BulkDeleteAsync(string namespaceId, IEnumerable<string> keys, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters namespaceId string The namespace ID. keys IEnumerable<string> Keys to delete (max 10,000 keys). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<KvBulkDeleteResult> Result indicating success/failure counts. Remarks The request body is a simple JSON array of key names: ["key1", "key2"]. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/kv/subresources/namespaces/methods/bulk_delete/ BulkGetAsync(string, IEnumerable<string>, CancellationToken) Retrieves multiple values in a single request. Task<IReadOnlyDictionary<string, string?>> BulkGetAsync(string namespaceId, IEnumerable<string> keys, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters namespaceId string The namespace ID. keys IEnumerable<string> Keys to retrieve (max 100 keys). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyDictionary<string, string>> Dictionary of key-value pairs (value is null for non-existent keys). Remarks The API returns values as a dictionary: { "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2" }. Use BulkGetWithMetadataAsync(string, IEnumerable<string>, CancellationToken) if you need metadata for each key. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/kv/subresources/namespaces/subresources/keys/methods/bulk_get/ BulkGetWithMetadataAsync(string, IEnumerable<string>, CancellationToken) Retrieves multiple values with metadata in a single request. Task<IReadOnlyDictionary<string, KvBulkGetItemWithMetadata?>> BulkGetWithMetadataAsync(string namespaceId, IEnumerable<string> keys, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters namespaceId string The namespace ID. keys IEnumerable<string> Keys to retrieve (max 100 keys). cancellationToken CancellationToken Cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyDictionary<string, KvBulkGetItemWithMetadata>> Dictionary of key-value pairs with metadata. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/kv/subresources/namespaces/subresources/keys/methods/bulk_get/ BulkWriteAsync(string, IEnumerable<KvBulkWriteItem>, CancellationToken) Writes multiple key-value pairs in a single request. Returns Task<KvBulkWriteResult> Result indicating success/failure counts. Remarks Existing values and expirations will be overwritten. Check UnsuccessfulKeys and retry if needed. api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models.R2Jur.title: Struct R2Jurisdiction | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models.R2Jur.summary: Struct R2Jurisdiction Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Represents a jurisdictional restriction for R2 bucket data storage. Jurisdictions provide a guarantee that objects stored in the bucket will remain within a specific geographic or regulatory boundary. Unlike location hints, jurisdictions are enforced constraints. [JsonConverter(typeof(ExtensibleEnumConverter<R2Jurisdiction>))] public readonly struct R2Jurisdiction : IExtensibleEnum<R2Jurisdiction>, IEquatable<R2Jurisdiction> Implements IExtensibleEnum<R2Jurisdiction> IEquatable<R2Jurisdiction> Inherited Members object.Equals(object, object) object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Examples // Create an EU jurisdiction bucket var bucket = await api.Buckets.CreateAsync("my-bucket", jurisdiction: R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); // IMPORTANT: Pass the same jurisdiction for all subsequent operations var details = await api.Buckets.GetAsync("my-bucket", R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); await api.Buckets.SetCorsAsync("my-bucket", corsPolicy, R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); await api.Buckets.DeleteAsync("my-bucket", R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); Remarks This is an extensible enum that provides IntelliSense for known values while allowing custom values for new jurisdictions that may be added to the Cloudflare API in the future. Important: When to Pass Jurisdiction to API Methods If you create a bucket with a jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion or FedRamp), you must pass the same jurisdiction value to all subsequent API operations on that bucket. Without it, the API returns error 10006 "The specified bucket does not exist" even though the bucket exists. The jurisdiction is required for: GetAsync, DeleteAsync, all CORS operations, all lifecycle operations, all custom domain operations, all managed domain operations, all lock operations, and all Sippy operations. The jurisdiction is not required for: ListAsync / ListAllAsync (returns all buckets with their jurisdiction in the response) and CreateTempCredentialsAsync (bucket is in the request body). Best Practice: Store the jurisdiction value when creating a bucket and reuse it for all subsequent operations on that bucket. When accessing jurisdictional buckets via the S3 API, you must specify the jurisdiction in the endpoint: https://{account_id}.{jurisdiction}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com The FedRamp jurisdiction requires Enterprise customer status. Contact your Cloudflare account team for access. Constructors R2Jurisdiction(string) Creates a new R2Jurisdiction with the specified value. public R2Jurisdiction(string value) Parameters value string The string value representing the jurisdiction. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when value is null. Properties Default No jurisdictional restriction. public static R2Jurisdiction Default { get; } Property Value R2Jurisdiction Remarks Data may be stored in any Cloudflare data center globally. This is the default when no jurisdiction is specified. EuropeanUnion European Union jurisdiction. public static R2Jurisdiction EuropeanUnion { get; } Property Value R2Jurisdiction Remarks Objects are guaranteed to be stored within the European Union, helping meet GDPR and other EU data residency requirements. When using the S3 API, use the endpoint: https://{account_id}.eu.r2.cloudflarestorage.com FedRamp FedRAMP jurisdiction. public static R2Jurisdiction FedRamp { get; } Property Value R2Jurisdiction Remarks Objects are stored in compliance with FedRAMP (Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program) requirements for U.S. federal government data. This jurisdiction requires Enterprise customer status. Contact your Cloudflare account team or Cloudflare Support for access. When using the S3 API, use the endpoint: https://{account_id}.fedramp.r2.cloudflarestorage.com Value Gets the underlying string value of this jurisdiction. public string Value { get; } Property Value string Methods Create(string) Creates a new instance of the extensible enum from the specified string value. public static R2Jurisdiction Create(string value) Parameters value string The string value to wrap. Returns R2Jurisdiction A new instance of R2Jurisdiction containing the specified value. Equals(R2Jurisdiction) Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type. public bool Equals(R2Jurisdiction other) Parameters other R2Jurisdiction An object to compare with this object. Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal. public override bool Equals(object? obj) Parameters obj object The object to compare with the current instance. Returns bool true if obj and this instance are the same type and represent the same value; otherwise, false. GetHashCode() Returns the hash code for this instance. public override int GetHashCode() Returns int A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance. GetS3EndpointUrl(string) Gets the S3-compatible endpoint URL for this jurisdiction. public string GetS3EndpointUrl(string accountId) Parameters accountId string The Cloudflare account ID. Returns string The full S3 endpoint URL for this jurisdiction. Examples var endpoint = R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion.GetS3EndpointUrl("abc123"); // Returns: "https://abc123.eu.r2.cloudflarestorage.com" var defaultEndpoint = R2Jurisdiction.Default.GetS3EndpointUrl("abc123"); // Returns: "https://abc123.r2.cloudflarestorage.com" Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is null or whitespace. GetS3Subdomain() Gets the S3 endpoint subdomain for this jurisdiction, or null for the default jurisdiction. public string? GetS3Subdomain() Returns string The subdomain string (e.g., "eu", "fedramp") for jurisdictional endpoints, or null for the default (global) jurisdiction. Examples R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion.GetS3Subdomain(); // Returns: "eu" R2Jurisdiction.FedRamp.GetS3Subdomain(); // Returns: "fedramp" R2Jurisdiction.Default.GetS3Subdomain(); // Returns: null ToString() Returns the fully qualified type name of this instance. public override string ToString() Returns string The fully qualified type name. api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models.R2Sto.summary: Struct R2StorageClass Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Represents a storage class for R2 objects. Storage classes determine the cost and access characteristics of stored objects. Different classes offer trade-offs between storage cost and retrieval latency/cost. [JsonConverter(typeof(ExtensibleEnumConverter<R2StorageClass>))] public readonly struct R2StorageClass : IExtensibleEnum<R2StorageClass>, IEquatable<R2StorageClass> Implements IExtensibleEnum<R2StorageClass> IEquatable<R2StorageClass> Inherited Members object.Equals(object, object) object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Examples // Using a known storage class with IntelliSense var storageClass = R2StorageClass.InfrequentAccess; // Using implicit conversion from string R2StorageClass customClass = "new-storage-class"; // In lifecycle transitions new StorageClassTransition( LifecycleCondition.AfterDays(30), R2StorageClass.InfrequentAccess ); Remarks This is an extensible enum that provides IntelliSense for known values while allowing custom values for new storage classes that may be added to the Cloudflare API in the future. The storage class can be set at the bucket level (as a default for new objects) or specified per-object during upload. Lifecycle rules can also transition objects between storage classes. Constructors R2StorageClass(string) Creates a new R2StorageClass with the specified value. public R2StorageClass(string value) Parameters value string The string value representing the storage class. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when value is null. Properties InfrequentAccess Infrequent Access storage class for less frequently accessed data. public static R2StorageClass InfrequentAccess { get; } Property Value R2StorageClass Remarks Offers lower storage costs compared to Standard, but with retrieval fees and a minimum storage duration. Ideal for backup data, disaster recovery, and data accessed less than once per month. Pricing: Lower storage rates with per-GB retrieval fees. Objects have a minimum billable storage duration. Standard Standard storage class for frequently accessed data. public static R2StorageClass Standard { get; } Property Value R2StorageClass Remarks This is the default storage class offering low-latency access with no minimum storage duration. Ideal for frequently accessed data, active content, and data requiring immediate retrieval. Pricing: Standard storage rates with no retrieval fees. api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Accounts.Models Classes AbortMultipartUploadsTransition Represents a transition to abort incomplete multipart uploads. Account Represents a Cloudflare account, the top-level container for zones and resources. Accounts own zones, Workers, R2 buckets, and other Cloudflare resources. Multiple users can be members of the same account with different permission levels. AccountManagedBy Parent organization information for accounts managed within an organizational hierarchy. This is used by enterprise customers to organize multiple accounts under a parent organization. AccountSettings Account settings including security and administrative configurations. These settings apply to all members and resources within the account. AttachCustomDomainRequest Defines the request payload for attaching a custom domain to a bucket. BucketCorsPolicy Represents the CORS policy for an R2 bucket. BucketLifecyclePolicy Represents the lifecycle policy for an R2 bucket. BucketLockCondition Represents the condition that determines how long objects are locked. BucketLockPolicy Represents the bucket lock policy containing all lock rules for a bucket. BucketLockRule Represents a single bucket lock rule. CorsAllowed Defines the allowed HTTP methods, origins, and headers for a CORS rule. CorsRule Represents a single CORS rule for an R2 bucket. CreateAccountRequest Request to create a new Cloudflare account. Note: This operation is only available to tenant administrators. Standard users cannot create accounts via the API. CreateBucketRequest Defines the request payload for creating an R2 bucket. CreateTempCredentialsRequest Defines the request payload for creating temporary R2 access credentials. CustomDomain Represents a custom domain in the list of custom domains for a bucket. CustomDomainResponse Represents the response from attaching or querying a custom domain. The custom converter handles the polymorphic 'status' field. The EdgeHostname may be null in some responses. CustomDomainResponseConverter A custom JSON converter for the CustomDomainResponse record. It handles the case where the "status" field from the Cloudflare API can be either a simple string (on creation) or a complex object (when querying an existing domain). CustomDomainStatusObject This helper record models the nested 'status' object returned by the Cloudflare API when querying an existing custom domain. DeleteAccountResult Result of deleting an account. Contains the identifier of the deleted account to confirm successful deletion. DeleteObjectsTransition Represents a transition to delete objects. EnableSippyFromAwsRequest Request to enable Sippy migration from AWS S3. EnableSippyFromGcsRequest Request to enable Sippy migration from Google Cloud Storage. EnableSippyRequest Base class for Sippy enable requests. LifecycleCondition Represents a condition that triggers a lifecycle transition. LifecycleRule Represents a single lifecycle rule for an R2 bucket. LifecycleRuleConditions Represents the filtering conditions for which objects a lifecycle rule applies to. ListAccountsFilters Filtering and pagination options for listing accounts. All properties are optional. When not specified, API defaults are used. ListCustomDomainsResponse Represents the response wrapper for listing custom domains. ListR2BucketsFilters Defines the filtering and pagination options for listing R2 Buckets. ListR2BucketsResponse Represents the nested response structure for listing R2 buckets. ManagedDomainResponse Represents the response for the R2-managed (r2.dev) domain configuration. R2Bucket Represents an R2 bucket returned by the Cloudflare API. SetManagedDomainRequest Defines the request payload for enabling or disabling the r2.dev subdomain. SippyAwsSource Represents the source bucket configuration for Sippy migration from AWS S3. SippyConfig Represents the current Sippy configuration for a bucket. SippyDestination Represents the destination R2 bucket configuration for Sippy. SippyGcsSource Represents the source bucket configuration for Sippy migration from Google Cloud Storage. SippySourceInfo Represents the source configuration returned by the API. This is a read-only representation without sensitive credential data. StorageClassTransition Represents a transition to change the storage class of objects. TempCredentials Represents the temporary access credentials returned by the API. UpdateAccountRequest Request to update an existing Cloudflare account. Both the name and settings can be updated in a single request. UpdateCustomDomainRequest Defines the request payload for updating a custom domain configuration. Structs AccountType Represents the type of a Cloudflare account. Account types indicate the tier or category of the account, such as standard or enterprise. R2Jurisdiction Represents a jurisdictional restriction for R2 bucket data storage. Jurisdictions provide a guarantee that objects stored in the bucket will remain within a specific geographic or regulatory boundary. Unlike location hints, jurisdictions are enforced constraints. R2LocationHint Represents a location hint for R2 bucket placement. Location hints provide a suggestion for the geographic region where the bucket's data should be stored. Cloudflare will attempt to honor this hint, but data may be placed in a nearby region if the specified location is unavailable. R2StorageClass Represents a storage class for R2 objects. Storage classes determine the cost and access characteristics of stored objects. Different classes offer trade-offs between storage cost and retrieval latency/cost. Interfaces IEnableSippySource Base interface for Sippy enable requests. Enums BucketLockConditionType Defines the condition type for bucket lock rules. LifecycleConditionType Defines the condition type for lifecycle rule transitions. SippyProvider Defines the supported cloud storage providers for Sippy migrations. TempCredentialPermission Defines the permission levels for temporary R2 credentials.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.AnalyticsAp.summary: Class AnalyticsApiFactory Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Analytics Assembly Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.dll Factory that creates named IAnalyticsApi instances. Each named client is configured with its own GraphQL endpoint and authentication token from the corresponding CloudflareApiOptions. public sealed class AnalyticsApiFactory : IAnalyticsApiFactory, IDisposable Inheritance object AnalyticsApiFactory Implements IAnalyticsApiFactory IDisposable Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This factory caches created clients to avoid the overhead of creating new GraphQL clients on every request. Clients are cached by name and reused for subsequent requests. Named clients are registered using AddCloudflareAnalytics(IServiceCollection, string) . Constructors AnalyticsApiFactory(IHttpClientFactory, IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions>, ILoggerFactory) Initializes a new instance of the AnalyticsApiFactory class. public AnalyticsApiFactory(IHttpClientFactory httpClientFactory, IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions> optionsMonitor, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory) Parameters httpClientFactory IHttpClientFactory The HTTP client factory. optionsMonitor IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions> The options monitor for named Cloudflare API options. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory The logger factory. Methods CreateClient(string) Creates an IAnalyticsApi instance configured with the specified named options. public IAnalyticsApi CreateClient(string name) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration to use. This must match the name used during registration. Returns IAnalyticsApi A new IAnalyticsApi instance configured with the named options. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown when no client with the specified name has been registered. Dispose() Disposes all cached GraphQL clients. public void Dispose()

api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.IAnalyticsA.summary: Interface IAnalyticsApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Analytics Assembly Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.dll Defines the contract for a generic client to the Cloudflare Analytics GraphQL API. public interface IAnalyticsApi Methods SendQueryAsync<TResponse>(GraphQLRequest, CancellationToken) Sends a GraphQL query to the Cloudflare API. Task<TResponse> SendQueryAsync<TResponse>(GraphQLRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters request GraphQLRequest The GraphQL request object, containing the query and variables. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<TResponse> A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the deserialized data from the API response's "data" field. Type Parameters TResponse The type to deserialize the GraphQL response data into. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown if the GraphQL API returns errors or if the response data is null.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.IAnalyticsA.title: Interface IAnalyticsApiFactory | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.IAnalyticsA.summary: Interface IAnalyticsApiFactory Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Analytics Assembly Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.dll Defines the contract for a factory that creates named IAnalyticsApi instances. This allows applications to query analytics data from multiple Cloudflare accounts simultaneously. public interface IAnalyticsApiFactory Remarks Named clients are registered using the AddCloudflareAnalytics(IServiceCollection, string) overload with a name parameter. The corresponding Cloudflare API options (with API token and GraphQL URL) must also be registered with the same name. // Registration - first register the Cloudflare API options with the name services.AddCloudflareApiClient("account1", options => { options.ApiToken = "token1"; options.GraphQlApiUrl = "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/graphql"; }); services.AddCloudflareAnalytics("account1"); services.AddCloudflareApiClient("account2", options => { options.ApiToken = "token2"; }); services.AddCloudflareAnalytics("account2"); // Usage via factory public class MyService(IAnalyticsApiFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var account1Api = factory.CreateClient("account1"); var account2Api = factory.CreateClient("account2"); // ... } } Methods CreateClient(string) Creates an IAnalyticsApi instance configured with the specified named options. IAnalyticsApi CreateClient(string name) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration to use. This must match the name used during registration. Returns IAnalyticsApi A new IAnalyticsApi instance configured with the named options. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown when no client with the specified name has been registered.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.ServiceColl.title: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.ServiceColl.summary: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Analytics Assembly Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.dll Provides extension methods for setting up the Cloudflare Analytics API client in an IServiceCollection. public static class ServiceCollectionExtensions Inheritance object ServiceCollectionExtensions Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods AddCloudflareAnalytics(IServiceCollection) Registers the IAnalyticsApi and its dependencies with the service collection. This method should be called after AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, IConfiguration) , as it relies on the core CloudflareApiOptions for authentication and endpoint configuration. Configuration is validated at application startup. If required settings (ApiToken, GraphQlApiUrl) are missing, an OptionsValidationException is thrown with a clear error message indicating what configuration is missing and how to fix it. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareAnalytics(this IServiceCollection services) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Exceptions OptionsValidationException Thrown at application startup if required configuration is missing or invalid. AddCloudflareAnalytics(IServiceCollection, string) Registers a named IAnalyticsApi configuration. Named clients can be retrieved using IAnalyticsApiFactory or via keyed services using [FromKeyedServices("name")]. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareAnalytics(this IServiceCollection services, string name) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. name string The unique name for this client configuration. This must match the name used when registering the corresponding CloudflareApiOptions via AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) . Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Examples // Register multiple named clients services.AddCloudflareApiClient("account1", options => { options.ApiToken = "token1"; options.AccountId = "account1-id"; }); services.AddCloudflareAnalytics("account1"); services.AddCloudflareApiClient("account2", options => { options.ApiToken = "token2"; options.AccountId = "account2-id"; }); services.AddCloudflareAnalytics("account2"); // Use via factory public class MyService(IAnalyticsApiFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var account1Api = factory.CreateClient("account1"); // ... } } // Or use via keyed services public class MyService([FromKeyedServices("account1")] IAnalyticsApi api) { // ... } Remarks This method requires that the Cloudflare API options for the same name are registered using AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) . The API token and GraphQL URL from those options are used for authentication and endpoint configuration. Unlike the default client registration, named clients are validated when first created via the factory or keyed services, not at application startup. This is because named configurations may be dynamically added or configured after startup. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. InvalidOperationException Thrown when the named client is created if required configuration is missing or invalid.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Analytics | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Analytics.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Analytics Classes AnalyticsApi Implements a generic client for the Cloudflare Analytics GraphQL endpoint. AnalyticsApiFactory Factory that creates named IAnalyticsApi instances. Each named client is configured with its own GraphQL endpoint and authentication token from the corresponding CloudflareApiOptions. ServiceCollectionExtensions Provides extension methods for setting up the Cloudflare Analytics API client in an IServiceCollection. Interfaces IAnalyticsApi Defines the contract for a generic client to the Cloudflare Analytics GraphQL API. IAnalyticsApiFactory Defines the contract for a factory that creates named IAnalyticsApi instances. This allows applications to query analytics data from multiple Cloudflare accounts simultaneously.

Methods CreateAccountTokenAsync(string, CreateApiTokenRequest, CancellationToken) Creates a new API token. Important: The returned Value contains the token secret. Store it securely - it cannot be retrieved again. public Task<CreateApiTokenResult> CreateAccountTokenAsync(string accountId, CreateApiTokenRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. request CreateApiTokenRequest The token creation parameters. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token.
