Examples var result = await client.ApiTokens.CreateAccountTokenAsync(accountId, new CreateApiTokenRequest( Name: "CI/CD Token", Policies: new[] { new CreateTokenPolicyRequest( Effect: "allow", PermissionGroups: new[] { new TokenPermissionGroupReference("...") }, Resources: new Dictionary<string, string> { ["com.cloudflare.api.account.*"] = "*" }) }, ExpiresOn: DateTime.UtcNow.AddYears(1))); Console.WriteLine($"Token: {result.Value}"); // Store securely! api/Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.IApiTokensA.summary: Interface IApiTokensApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for API token management operations. API tokens provide fine-grained access control for Cloudflare API operations. This interface handles account-scoped tokens. User-scoped tokens will be added in F17. public interface IApiTokensApi Examples // Create a new token var result = await client.ApiTokens.CreateAccountTokenAsync(accountId, new CreateApiTokenRequest( Name: "CI/CD Token", Policies: new[] { new CreateTokenPolicyRequest( Effect: "allow", PermissionGroups: new[] { new TokenPermissionGroupReference(permissionGroupId) }, Resources: new Dictionary<string, string> { ["com.cloudflare.api.account.*"] = "*" }) })); // Store the token value securely - it cannot be retrieved again! Console.WriteLine($"Token: {result.Value}"); // Later, roll the token to generate a new secret var newValue = await client.ApiTokens.RollAccountTokenAsync(accountId, result.Id); Remarks Key features of API tokens: Policy-based access control with allow/deny effects IP address restrictions using CIDR notation Time-bounded validity with not_before and expires_on Secret rotation without recreating the token Methods CreateAccountTokenAsync(string, CreateApiTokenRequest, CancellationToken) Creates a new API token. Important: The returned Value contains the token secret. Store it securely - it cannot be retrieved again. api/Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.Models.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.Models | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.Models.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.Models Classes ApiToken Represents an account-owned API token. API tokens provide fine-grained access control for Cloudflare API operations. Each token has policies that define what resources and actions are allowed. CreateApiTokenRequest Request to create a new API token. CreateApiTokenResult Result of creating a new API token, including the secret value. Important: The Value property contains the token secret and is only available at creation time. Store it securely - it cannot be retrieved again. CreateTokenPolicyRequest Policy definition for creating a token. ListApiTokensFilters Filtering and pagination options for listing API tokens. ListPermissionGroupsFilters Filtering options for listing permission groups. PermissionGroup Represents a permission group that can be assigned to API tokens. Permission groups define what API operations a token can perform. Use GetAccountPermissionGroupsAsync(string, ListPermissionGroupsFilters?, CancellationToken) to discover available groups. TokenCondition IP-based access conditions for a token. Conditions allow restricting token usage based on the source IP address of the API request. TokenIpCondition IP address inclusion/exclusion rules for token access. Supports both allowlist (in) and denylist (not_in) patterns using CIDR notation. TokenPermissionGroupReference Reference to a permission group within a token policy. TokenPolicy A token policy defining allowed or denied permissions and resources. Each policy specifies an effect (allow or deny), the permission groups that define what actions are permitted, and the resources the policy applies to. UpdateApiTokenRequest Request to update an existing API token. VerifyTokenResult Result of verifying a token. Structs TokenStatus Represents the status of an API token. Token status indicates whether the token is currently usable for API operations. ActiveToken is active and can be used for API requests DisabledToken has been manually disabled ExpiredToken has passed its expiration date

api/Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.ApiTokens Classes ApiTokensApi Implements the API for managing Cloudflare API tokens. API tokens provide fine-grained access control for Cloudflare API operations. Each token has policies that define what resources and actions are allowed. Interfaces IApiTokensApi Defines the contract for API token management operations. API tokens provide fine-grained access control for Cloudflare API operations. This interface handles account-scoped tokens. User-scoped tokens will be added in F17.

This is a beta API and error handling may be incomplete. public Task<CursorPaginatedResult<AuditLog>> GetAccountAuditLogsAsync(string accountId, ListAuditLogsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAuditLogsFilters Optional filtering and pagination options. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Examples // Get recent audit logs var logs = await client.AuditLogs.GetAccountAuditLogsAsync(accountId, new ListAuditLogsFilters( Since: DateTime.UtcNow.AddDays(-7), Limit: 100)); foreach (var log in logs.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{log.Action.Time}: {log.Action.Type} by {log.Actor.Email}"); } Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is null or whitespace. api/Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs.Models.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs.Models | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs.Models.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs.Models Classes AuditLog Represents an audit log entry recording an action taken on account resources. Audit logs are retained for 18 months (v1 API) or 30 days (v2 API). Use filtering parameters to narrow results when querying large datasets. AuditLogAccount Account context for an audit log entry. AuditLogAction Action details for an audit log entry. AuditLogActor Actor (who performed the action) for an audit log entry. AuditLogOwner Owner (account) reference for an audit log entry. AuditLogRaw Raw HTTP request details for an audit log entry. AuditLogResource Resource details for an audit log entry. AuditLogZone Zone context for an audit log entry. ListAuditLogsFilters Filtering and pagination options for listing audit logs. All filter arrays support both inclusion and exclusion. Use the main array for inclusion, and the corresponding Not array for exclusion.

api/Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.AuditLogs Classes AuditLogsApi Provides methods for interacting with the Cloudflare Audit Logs API. Audit logs record actions taken on account resources and are retained for 30 days. Interfaces IAuditLogsApi Defines the contract for audit log operations. Audit logs provide a record of actions taken on account and user resources. Logs are retained for 30 days. This interface handles both account-scoped and user-scoped audit logs.

api/Cloudflare.NET.CloudflareApiClient.h.title: Class CloudflareApiClient | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.CloudflareApiClient.h.summary: Class CloudflareApiClient Namespace Cloudflare.NET Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll The primary client for interacting with the Cloudflare API. public sealed class CloudflareApiClient : ICloudflareApiClient, IDisposable Inheritance object CloudflareApiClient Implements ICloudflareApiClient IDisposable Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors CloudflareApiClient(HttpClient, IOptions<CloudflareApiOptions>, ILoggerFactory) Initializes a new instance of the Cloudflare API client. public CloudflareApiClient(HttpClient httpClient, IOptions<CloudflareApiOptions> options, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory) Parameters httpClient HttpClient The HttpClient to be used for all API calls. options IOptions<CloudflareApiOptions> The Cloudflare API options. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory The factory to create loggers for API resources. Properties Accounts Gets the API resource for managing Account-level resources. This includes R2 buckets, account-wide IP Access Rules, and account-level WAF custom rulesets. public IAccountsApi Accounts { get; } Property Value IAccountsApi ApiTokens Gets the API resource for managing API tokens. API tokens provide fine-grained access control for Cloudflare API operations. Each token has policies that define what resources and actions are allowed. public IApiTokensApi ApiTokens { get; } Property Value IApiTokensApi Examples // Create a new token var result = await cf.ApiTokens.CreateAccountTokenAsync(accountId, new CreateApiTokenRequest( Name: "CI/CD Token", Policies: new[] { new CreateTokenPolicyRequest( Effect: "allow", PermissionGroups: new[] { new TokenPermissionGroupReference(permGroupId) }, Resources: new Dictionary<string, string> { ["com.cloudflare.api.account.*"] = "*" }) })); Console.WriteLine($"Token: {result.Value}"); // Store securely! AuditLogs Gets the API resource for accessing audit logs. Audit logs provide a record of actions taken on account resources, useful for security monitoring, compliance, and troubleshooting. Logs are retained for 30 days. public IAuditLogsApi AuditLogs { get; } Property Value IAuditLogsApi Examples // Get recent audit logs var logs = await cf.AuditLogs.GetAccountAuditLogsAsync(accountId, new ListAuditLogsFilters(Since: DateTime.UtcNow.AddDays(-7))); foreach (var log in logs.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{log.Action.Time}: {log.Action.Type} by {log.Actor.Email}"); } Dns Gets the API resource for managing DNS records. Provides complete CRUD operations for DNS records, including batch operations, import/export functionality, and searching by hostname. public IDnsApi Dns { get; } Property Value IDnsApi Examples // Create a DNS record var record = await cf.Dns.CreateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, new CreateDnsRecordRequest( DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.1" )); // List all DNS records await foreach (var r in cf.Dns.ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{r.Name}: {r.Content}"); } Members Gets the API resource for managing account members. Account members are users who have been granted access to a Cloudflare account. Members are assigned roles that determine their permissions within the account. public IMembersApi Members { get; } Property Value IMembersApi Examples // List all account members await foreach (var member in cf.Members.ListAllAccountMembersAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{member.User.Email}: {member.Status}"); foreach (var role in member.Roles) Console.WriteLine($" - {role.Name}"); } // Invite a new member var newMember = await cf.Members.CreateAccountMemberAsync(accountId, new CreateAccountMemberRequest( Email: "newuser@example.com", Roles: new[] { adminRoleId }, Status: MemberStatus.Pending)); Roles Gets the API resource for managing account roles. Roles are predefined by Cloudflare and define sets of permissions that can be assigned to account members. This API is read-only. public IRolesApi Roles { get; } Property Value IRolesApi Examples // List all available roles await foreach (var role in cf.Roles.ListAllAccountRolesAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Name}: {role.Description}"); if (role.Permissions.Dns?.Write == true) Console.WriteLine(" - Can modify DNS"); } Subscriptions Gets the API resource for managing subscriptions. Subscriptions manage billing plans and add-ons for Cloudflare services. This API provides access to account-level subscription management. public ISubscriptionsApi Subscriptions { get; } Property Value ISubscriptionsApi Examples // List account subscriptions var subscriptions = await cf.Subscriptions.ListAccountSubscriptionsAsync(accountId); foreach (var sub in subscriptions) { Console.WriteLine($"{sub.RatePlan?.PublicName}: {sub.State}"); Console.WriteLine($" Price: {sub.Price} {sub.Currency}/{sub.Frequency}"); } // Create a new subscription var newSub = await cf.Subscriptions.CreateAccountSubscriptionAsync(accountId, new CreateAccountSubscriptionRequest( RatePlan: new RatePlanReference("rate_plan_id"), Frequency: SubscriptionFrequency.Monthly)); Remarks Billing Permissions Required: Requires tokens with Billing Read/Write permissions. Cost Warning: Creating or updating subscriptions may incur charges. Turnstile Gets the API resource for managing Turnstile widgets. Turnstile is Cloudflare's CAPTCHA alternative that provides bot protection without user friction. Widgets are account-scoped resources. public ITurnstileApi Turnstile { get; } Property Value ITurnstileApi Examples // Create a Turnstile widget var widget = await cf.Turnstile.CreateWidgetAsync(accountId, new CreateTurnstileWidgetRequest( Name: "Contact Form", Domains: new[] { "example.com" }, Mode: WidgetMode.Managed)); // IMPORTANT: Store the secret securely - it won't be available again! Console.WriteLine($"Sitekey: {widget.Sitekey}"); Console.WriteLine($"Secret: {widget.Secret}"); // Later, rotate the secret var result = await cf.Turnstile.RotateSecretAsync(accountId, widget.Sitekey); Console.WriteLine($"New secret: {result.Secret}"); Remarks Important: Widget secrets are only returned on creation and rotation. Store them securely as they cannot be retrieved again. User Gets the API resource for managing the authenticated user's profile. This includes retrieving and editing the current user's personal information, such as name, country, and contact details. public IUserApi User { get; } Property Value IUserApi Workers Gets the API resource for managing Worker routes. Worker routes map URL patterns to Worker scripts, determining which requests are handled by which Workers. Routes are zone-scoped resources. public IWorkersApi Workers { get; } Property Value IWorkersApi Examples // List all Worker routes in a zone var routes = await cf.Workers.ListRoutesAsync(zoneId); foreach (var route in routes) { Console.WriteLine($"{route.Pattern} -> {route.Script ?? "(disabled)"}"); } // Create a new route var newRoute = await cf.Workers.CreateRouteAsync(zoneId, new CreateWorkerRouteRequest( Pattern: "api.example.com/*", Script: "api-handler")); Zones Gets the API resource for managing Zone-level resources. This includes DNS records, zone-specific IP Access Rules, WAF configurations, and other settings scoped to a specific zone. public IZonesApi Zones { get; } Property Value IZonesApi Methods Dispose() Disposes this client instance. public void Dispose() Remarks For DI-managed clients, this method does nothing because the HttpClient lifetime is managed by IHttpClientFactory. The factory handles pooling and disposal of the underlying handlers automatically. For dynamic clients created via CreateClient(CloudflareApiOptions), the Cloudflare.NET.Core.DynamicCloudflareApiClient wrapper handles actual disposal of resources.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.CloudflareApiCli.title: Class CloudflareApiClientFactory | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.CloudflareApiCli.summary: Class CloudflareApiClientFactory Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Factory that creates named ICloudflareApiClient instances. Each named client is configured with its own CloudflareApiOptions and uses a dedicated HttpClient with appropriate authentication and resilience. public sealed class CloudflareApiClientFactory : ICloudflareApiClientFactory Inheritance object CloudflareApiClientFactory Implements ICloudflareApiClientFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This factory is used to support multiple Cloudflare configurations within a single application, such as connecting to different accounts or using different API tokens. Named clients are registered using AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) . Constructors CloudflareApiClientFactory(IHttpClientFactory, IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions>, ILoggerFactory) Initializes a new instance of the CloudflareApiClientFactory class. public CloudflareApiClientFactory(IHttpClientFactory httpClientFactory, IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions> optionsMonitor, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory) Parameters httpClientFactory IHttpClientFactory The HTTP client factory. optionsMonitor IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions> The options monitor for named options. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory The logger factory. Methods CreateClient(CloudflareApiOptions) Creates an ICloudflareApiClient instance dynamically from the provided options, without requiring pre-registration in the DI container. public ICloudflareApiClient CreateClient(CloudflareApiOptions options) Parameters options CloudflareApiOptions The configuration options for the client. Returns ICloudflareApiClient A fully configured ICloudflareApiClient with authentication and resilience (rate limiting, retries, circuit breaker, timeouts). Examples // Create a dynamic client for a user-provided account var options = new CloudflareApiOptions { ApiToken = userProvidedToken, AccountId = userProvidedAccountId, RateLimiting = new RateLimitingOptions { IsEnabled = true, PermitLimit = 10 // Conservative limit for user accounts } }; var client = factory.CreateClient(options); Remarks Use this method when client configurations are not known at application startup, such as when users can add Cloudflare accounts at runtime through a UI. The returned client manages its own HttpClient instance and should be disposed when no longer needed to release resources. Use a using statement or call Dispose(): using var client = factory.CreateClient(options); var zones = await client.Zones.ListZonesAsync(); // Client is disposed when the using scope ends Each dynamic client has its own isolated resilience pipeline (rate limiter, circuit breaker, etc.). Dynamic clients do not share state with pre-registered named clients or other dynamic clients. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when options is null. InvalidOperationException Thrown when the options fail validation (e.g., missing ApiToken). CreateClient(string) Creates an ICloudflareApiClient instance configured with the specified named options. public ICloudflareApiClient CreateClient(string name) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration to use. This must match the name used during registration. Returns ICloudflareApiClient A new ICloudflareApiClient instance configured with the named options. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown when no client with the specified name has been registered.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.CloudflareApiOpt.title: Class CloudflareApiOptions | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.CloudflareApiOpt.summary: Class CloudflareApiOptions Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Represents the configuration options required for the Cloudflare API client. public class CloudflareApiOptions Inheritance object CloudflareApiOptions Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties AccountId The Cloudflare Account ID. Required for account-level API calls. public string AccountId { get; set; } Property Value string ApiBaseUrl The base URL for the Cloudflare REST API. Defaults to the standard v4 endpoint. public string ApiBaseUrl { get; set; } Property Value string ApiToken The Cloudflare API token. This is required for authentication. public string ApiToken { get; set; } Property Value string DefaultTimeout Gets or sets the default timeout for a single HTTP request attempt. Defaults to 30 seconds. This can be configured in appsettings.json (e.g., "00:00:30"). public TimeSpan DefaultTimeout { get; set; } Property Value TimeSpan GraphQlApiUrl The URL for the Cloudflare GraphQL API. Defaults to the standard endpoint. public string GraphQlApiUrl { get; set; } Property Value string RateLimiting Gets or sets the configuration for automatic rate-limit handling. public RateLimitingOptions RateLimiting { get; set; } Property Value RateLimitingOptions

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.CloudflareHttpCl.title: Class CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.CloudflareHttpCl.summary: Class CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Configures HttpClient instances for Cloudflare API communication. Used by both DI registration and dynamic client creation paths to ensure consistent HTTP client configuration. public static class CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator Inheritance object CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class centralizes the HttpClient configuration logic that was previously duplicated between the DI registration path and the dynamic client creation path. Configuration includes: Base Address - Set from ApiBaseUrl. Timeout - Set to a long value (5 minutes) to allow the resilience pipeline to handle timeouts. The actual timeout is controlled by the pipeline. Authorization Header - Optionally set from ApiToken. Methods Configure(HttpClient, CloudflareApiOptions, bool) Configures an HttpClient for Cloudflare API communication. public static void Configure(HttpClient client, CloudflareApiOptions options, bool setAuthorizationHeader = true) Parameters client HttpClient The HttpClient to configure. options CloudflareApiOptions The Cloudflare API options containing configuration values. setAuthorizationHeader bool If true, sets the Authorization header from the options. Set to false when authentication is handled separately (e.g., via AuthenticationHandler). Examples // For DI registration path (auth handled by AuthenticationHandler) CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator.Configure(httpClient, options, setAuthorizationHeader: false); // For named clients or dynamic clients (auth header set directly) CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator.Configure(httpClient, options, setAuthorizationHeader: true); Remarks The HttpClient timeout is set to a long value (5 minutes) to ensure that the resilience pipeline's timeout strategies are the effective timeout controllers. Without this, the HttpClient's default 100-second timeout would interfere with retry attempts. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when client or options is null. InvalidOperationException Thrown when ApiBaseUrl is null or whitespace. ConfigureBase(HttpClient, CloudflareApiOptions) Configures only the base properties of an HttpClient (base address and timeout), without setting the Authorization header. public static void ConfigureBase(HttpClient client, CloudflareApiOptions options) Parameters client HttpClient The HttpClient to configure. options CloudflareApiOptions The Cloudflare API options containing configuration values. Remarks This overload is provided for backward compatibility and convenience when authentication is handled by a separate AuthenticationHandler. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when client or options is null. InvalidOperationException Thrown when ApiBaseUrl is null or whitespace.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.ICloudflareApiCl.title: Interface ICloudflareApiClientFactory | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.ICloudflareApiCl.summary: Interface ICloudflareApiClientFactory Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for a factory that creates named ICloudflareApiClient instances. This allows applications to work with multiple Cloudflare accounts or configurations simultaneously. public interface ICloudflareApiClientFactory Remarks Named clients are registered using the AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) overload with a name parameter. // Registration services.AddCloudflareApiClient("production", options => { options.ApiToken = "prod-token"; options.AccountId = "prod-account-id"; }); services.AddCloudflareApiClient("staging", options => { options.ApiToken = "staging-token"; options.AccountId = "staging-account-id"; }); // Usage via factory public class MyService(ICloudflareApiClientFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var prodClient = factory.CreateClient("production"); var stagingClient = factory.CreateClient("staging"); // ... } } Methods CreateClient(CloudflareApiOptions) Creates an ICloudflareApiClient instance dynamically from the provided options, without requiring pre-registration in the DI container. ICloudflareApiClient CreateClient(CloudflareApiOptions options) Parameters options CloudflareApiOptions The configuration options for the client. Returns ICloudflareApiClient A fully configured ICloudflareApiClient with authentication and resilience (rate limiting, retries, circuit breaker, timeouts). Examples // Create a dynamic client for a user-provided account var options = new CloudflareApiOptions { ApiToken = userProvidedToken, AccountId = userProvidedAccountId, RateLimiting = new RateLimitingOptions { IsEnabled = true, PermitLimit = 10 // Conservative limit for user accounts } }; var client = factory.CreateClient(options); Remarks Use this method when client configurations are not known at application startup, such as when users can add Cloudflare accounts at runtime through a UI. The returned client manages its own HttpClient instance and should be disposed when no longer needed to release resources. Use a using statement or call Dispose(): using var client = factory.CreateClient(options); var zones = await client.Zones.ListZonesAsync(); // Client is disposed when the using scope ends Each dynamic client has its own isolated resilience pipeline (rate limiter, circuit breaker, etc.). Dynamic clients do not share state with pre-registered named clients or other dynamic clients. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when options is null. InvalidOperationException Thrown when the options fail validation (e.g., missing ApiToken). CreateClient(string) Creates an ICloudflareApiClient instance configured with the specified named options. ICloudflareApiClient CreateClient(string name) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration to use. This must match the name used during registration. Returns ICloudflareApiClient A new ICloudflareApiClient instance configured with the named options. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown when no client with the specified name has been registered.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Json.IExtensible.title: Interface IExtensibleEnum<TSelf> | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Json.IExtensible.summary: Interface IExtensibleEnum<TSelf> Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core.Json Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for an extensible enum type that wraps a string value. Extensible enums provide strong typing and IntelliSense for known values while allowing custom values to be specified when the API adds new options that the SDK doesn't yet know about. public interface IExtensibleEnum<TSelf> where TSelf : struct, IExtensibleEnum<TSelf> Type Parameters TSelf The implementing type itself (for static factory method). Examples // Using a known value with IntelliSense var location = R2LocationHint.EastNorthAmerica; // Using a custom value if API adds new options R2LocationHint customLocation = "new-region"; Remarks This pattern is commonly used by cloud SDKs (Azure SDK, AWS SDK) to handle API evolution gracefully. Implementers should provide static properties for known values and implicit conversion operators for seamless string interoperability. Properties Value Gets the underlying string value of this extensible enum. string Value { get; } Property Value string Methods Create(string) Creates a new instance of the extensible enum from the specified string value. public static abstract TSelf Create(string value) Parameters value string The string value to wrap. Returns TSelf A new instance of TSelf containing the specified value.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.RateLimitingOpti.title: Class RateLimitingOptions | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.RateLimitingOpti.summary: Class RateLimitingOptions Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Configures the automatic retry policy for rate-limited requests (HTTP 429). public class RateLimitingOptions Inheritance object RateLimitingOptions Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties EnableProactiveThrottling Gets or sets a value indicating whether proactive throttling based on server rate limit headers is enabled. When enabled, the client will automatically delay requests when the remaining quota falls below the threshold, preventing 429 responses before they occur. Defaults to true. public bool EnableProactiveThrottling { get; set; } Property Value bool IsEnabled Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic rate-limit handling is enabled. Defaults to false. public bool IsEnabled { get; set; } Property Value bool MaxRetries Gets or sets the maximum number of retries for a rate-limited request. Defaults to 2. public int MaxRetries { get; set; } Property Value int PermitLimit Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent requests allowed by the client-side rate limiter. Defaults to 25. This helps prevent sending a burst of requests that would trigger a 429 response. public int PermitLimit { get; set; } Property Value int QueueLimit Gets or sets the number of requests that can be queued when the concurrency limit is reached. Defaults to 50. public int QueueLimit { get; set; } Property Value int QuotaLowThreshold Gets or sets the threshold (0.0 to 1.0) at which proactive throttling begins. For example, 0.1 means throttling starts when only 10% of the quota remains. Defaults to 0.1 (10%). public double QuotaLowThreshold { get; set; } Property Value double

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Resilience.Cloud.title: Class CloudflareResiliencePipelineBuilder | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Resilience.Cloud.summary: Class CloudflareResiliencePipelineBuilder Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core.Resilience Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Builds and configures resilience pipelines for Cloudflare API clients. Used by both DI registration and dynamic client creation paths to ensure consistent resilience behavior. public static class CloudflareResiliencePipelineBuilder Inheritance object CloudflareResiliencePipelineBuilder Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks The resilience pipeline includes the following strategies (outermost to innermost): Rate Limiter - Client-side concurrency limiting to prevent overwhelming the API. Rate Limit Headers - Proactive throttling based on server-returned rate limit headers. Total Request Timeout - Overall timeout (60 seconds) covering all retries. Retry Strategy - Exponential backoff with jitter for transient failures (only for idempotent HTTP methods). Circuit Breaker - Stops sending requests after consecutive failures. Attempt Timeout - Per-request timeout from DefaultTimeout. Methods Build(CloudflareApiOptions, ILogger?, string?) Builds a standalone resilience pipeline configured for Cloudflare API calls. public static ResiliencePipeline<HttpResponseMessage> Build(CloudflareApiOptions options, ILogger? logger = null, string? clientName = null) Parameters options CloudflareApiOptions The Cloudflare API options containing resilience configuration. logger ILogger Optional logger for resilience events. If null, events are not logged. clientName string Optional client name for logging context and strategy naming. Returns ResiliencePipeline<HttpResponseMessage> A configured ResiliencePipeline<T> ready for use with an HttpClient. Examples var pipeline = CloudflareResiliencePipelineBuilder.Build(options, logger); var handler = new ResilienceDelegatingHandler(pipeline, new SocketsHttpHandler()); var httpClient = new HttpClient(handler); Remarks This method is used by the dynamic client creation path to build a resilience pipeline without requiring DI registration. The pipeline can be used with a Cloudflare.NET.Core.Resilience.ResilienceDelegatingHandler to wrap an HttpClient. Configure(ResiliencePipelineBuilder<HttpResponseMessage>, CloudflareApiOptions, ILogger?, string?) Configures an existing resilience pipeline builder with Cloudflare-specific strategies (rate limiting, retries, circuit breaker, timeouts). public static void Configure(ResiliencePipelineBuilder<HttpResponseMessage> builder, CloudflareApiOptions options, ILogger? logger = null, string? clientName = null) Parameters builder ResiliencePipelineBuilder<HttpResponseMessage> The resilience pipeline builder to configure. options CloudflareApiOptions The Cloudflare API options containing resilience configuration. logger ILogger Optional logger for resilience events. If null, events are not logged. clientName string Optional client name for logging context and strategy naming. Remarks This method is used by the DI registration path via AddResilienceHandler(). The same configuration logic is used by Build(CloudflareApiOptions, ILogger?, string?) for dynamic clients.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.ServiceCollectio.title: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.ServiceCollectio.summary: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Provides extension methods for setting up the Cloudflare API client in an IServiceCollection. public static class ServiceCollectionExtensions Inheritance object ServiceCollectionExtensions Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, IConfiguration) Registers the ICloudflareApiClient and its dependencies using a configuration section. This is a convenience method that binds to the "Cloudflare" section of the application's IConfiguration. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareApiClient(this IServiceCollection services, IConfiguration configuration) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. configuration IConfiguration The application configuration. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) Registers the ICloudflareApiClient and its dependencies, allowing for fine-grained programmatic configuration. This method sets up the necessary HttpClient, authentication handler, and resilience policies for rate limiting and transient error handling. Configuration is validated at application startup. If required settings (ApiToken) are missing, an OptionsValidationException is thrown with a clear error message indicating what configuration is missing and how to fix it. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareApiClient(this IServiceCollection services, Action<CloudflareApiOptions> configureOptions) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. configureOptions Action<CloudflareApiOptions> An action to configure the CloudflareApiOptions. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Exceptions OptionsValidationException Thrown at application startup if required configuration is missing or invalid. AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, IConfiguration) Registers a named ICloudflareApiClient configuration using a configuration section. Named clients can be retrieved using ICloudflareApiClientFactory or via keyed services using [FromKeyedServices("name")]. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareApiClient(this IServiceCollection services, string name, IConfiguration configuration) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. name string The unique name for this client configuration. Used to retrieve the client from the factory or via keyed services. configuration IConfiguration The application configuration. Will bind to the "Cloudflare:" section. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) Registers a named ICloudflareApiClient configuration with programmatic options. Named clients can be retrieved using ICloudflareApiClientFactory or via keyed services using [FromKeyedServices("name")]. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareApiClient(this IServiceCollection services, string name, Action<CloudflareApiOptions> configureOptions) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. name string The unique name for this client configuration. Used to retrieve the client from the factory or via keyed services. configureOptions Action<CloudflareApiOptions> An action to configure the CloudflareApiOptions. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Examples // Register multiple named clients services.AddCloudflareApiClient("production", options => { options.ApiToken = "prod-token"; options.AccountId = "prod-account-id"; }); services.AddCloudflareApiClient("staging", options => { options.ApiToken = "staging-token"; options.AccountId = "staging-account-id"; }); // Use via factory public class MyService(ICloudflareApiClientFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var prodClient = factory.CreateClient("production"); // ... } } // Or use via keyed services public class MyService([FromKeyedServices("production")] ICloudflareApiClient client) { // ... } Remarks Unlike the default client registration, named clients are validated when first created via the factory or keyed services, not at application startup. This is because named configurations may be dynamically added or configured after startup. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. InvalidOperationException Thrown when the named client is created if required configuration is missing or invalid.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Validation.Cloud.title: Class CloudflareApiOptionsValidator | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Validation.Cloud.summary: Class CloudflareApiOptionsValidator Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core.Validation Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Validates CloudflareApiOptions to ensure all required configuration is present and valid. This validator is invoked at startup when using ValidateOnStart(), providing immediate feedback for configuration issues rather than waiting for the first API call to fail. public class CloudflareApiOptionsValidator : IValidateOptions<CloudflareApiOptions> Inheritance object CloudflareApiOptionsValidator Implements IValidateOptions<CloudflareApiOptions> Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This validator checks that the API token is provided, which is required for authentication with the Cloudflare API. Additional validation (such as AccountId for R2 or GraphQL URL for Analytics) is performed by package-specific validators. The validation errors are designed to be clear and actionable, mentioning "Cloudflare" explicitly so developers can quickly identify the source of configuration issues. When registered as IValidateOptions<TOptions>, this validator skips named options by default. Factories should use ValidateConfiguration(string?, CloudflareApiOptions, CloudflareValidationRequirements) directly for explicit validation of named client configurations with custom exception types. Constructors CloudflareApiOptionsValidator() Initializes a new instance of the CloudflareApiOptionsValidator class with default validation requirements (ApiToken required) and default skip behavior for named options. public CloudflareApiOptionsValidator() CloudflareApiOptionsValidator(CloudflareValidationRequirements) Initializes a new instance of the CloudflareApiOptionsValidator class with specific validation requirements and default skip behavior for named options. public CloudflareApiOptionsValidator(CloudflareValidationRequirements requirements) Parameters requirements CloudflareValidationRequirements The validation requirements to apply. CloudflareApiOptionsValidator(CloudflareValidationRequirements, bool) Initializes a new instance of the CloudflareApiOptionsValidator class with specific validation requirements and explicit skip behavior control. public CloudflareApiOptionsValidator(CloudflareValidationRequirements requirements, bool skipNamedOptions) Parameters requirements CloudflareValidationRequirements The validation requirements to apply. skipNamedOptions bool If true, the validator returns Skip for named options (non-default names). Set to false when performing explicit validation in factories. Methods Validate(string?, CloudflareApiOptions) Validates a specific named options instance (or all when name is null). public ValidateOptionsResult Validate(string? name, CloudflareApiOptions options) Parameters name string The name of the options instance being validated. options CloudflareApiOptions The options instance. Returns ValidateOptionsResult The ValidateOptionsResult result. ValidateConfiguration(string?, CloudflareApiOptions, CloudflareValidationRequirements) Validates the specified CloudflareApiOptions against the given requirements. This method is intended for use by factories to perform explicit validation with proper error messages that include the client name. public static ValidateOptionsResult ValidateConfiguration(string? name, CloudflareApiOptions options, CloudflareValidationRequirements requirements) Parameters name string The options name. For named clients, this should be the client name to include in error messages. For default clients, pass null or DefaultName. options CloudflareApiOptions The options to validate. requirements CloudflareValidationRequirements The validation requirements to apply. Returns ValidateOptionsResult A ValidateOptionsResult indicating success or failure with error messages.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Validation.Cloud.title: Class CloudflareValidationRequirements | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.Validation.Cloud.summary: Class CloudflareValidationRequirements Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core.Validation Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Specifies which properties of CloudflareApiOptions are required for validation. This allows different packages (Core, R2, Analytics) to have different validation requirements. public sealed class CloudflareValidationRequirements Inheritance object CloudflareValidationRequirements Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties Default Default validation requirements: only ApiToken is required. Suitable for the Core API client. public static CloudflareValidationRequirements Default { get; } Property Value CloudflareValidationRequirements ForAnalytics Validation requirements for the Analytics client: ApiToken and GraphQlApiUrl are required. public static CloudflareValidationRequirements ForAnalytics { get; } Property Value CloudflareValidationRequirements ForR2 Validation requirements for the R2 client: AccountId is required. The API token is not required for R2 data plane operations (uses S3 credentials instead). public static CloudflareValidationRequirements ForR2 { get; } Property Value CloudflareValidationRequirements RequireAccountId Gets a value indicating whether the AccountId is required. Defaults to false. public bool RequireAccountId { get; init; } Property Value bool RequireApiBaseUrl Gets a value indicating whether the ApiBaseUrl is required. Defaults to false. public bool RequireApiBaseUrl { get; init; } Property Value bool RequireApiToken Gets a value indicating whether the ApiToken is required. Defaults to true. public bool RequireApiToken { get; init; } Property Value bool RequireGraphQlApiUrl Gets a value indicating whether the GraphQlApiUrl is required. Defaults to false. public bool RequireGraphQlApiUrl { get; init; } Property Value bool

api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Core.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Core Classes ApiResource Base class for API resource clients, providing shared functionality. CloudflareApiClientFactory Factory that creates named ICloudflareApiClient instances. Each named client is configured with its own CloudflareApiOptions and uses a dedicated HttpClient with appropriate authentication and resilience. CloudflareApiOptions Represents the configuration options required for the Cloudflare API client. CloudflareHttpClientConfigurator Configures HttpClient instances for Cloudflare API communication. Used by both DI registration and dynamic client creation paths to ensure consistent HTTP client configuration. LoggingConstants Centralized logging categories for Cloudflare.NET. Use these instead of raw strings to enable consistent, DRY category filtering and avoid typos. LoggingConstants.Categories RateLimitingOptions Configures the automatic retry policy for rate-limited requests (HTTP 429). ServiceCollectionExtensions Provides extension methods for setting up the Cloudflare API client in an IServiceCollection. Interfaces ICloudflareApiClientFactory Defines the contract for a factory that creates named ICloudflareApiClient instances. This allows applications to work with multiple Cloudflare accounts or configurations simultaneously.

HttpClient for making API requests. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory The factory to create loggers. Methods BatchDnsRecordsAsync(string, BatchDnsRecordsRequest, CancellationToken) Performs batch DNS record operations in a single API call. Execution Order: Deletes  Patches  Puts  Posts. This order allows you to delete a record and re-create it with the same name in one batch. public Task<BatchDnsRecordsResult> BatchDnsRecordsAsync(string zoneId, BatchDnsRecordsRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. request BatchDnsRecordsRequest The batch request containing operations to perform. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BatchDnsRecordsResult> The result containing the outcome of each operation type. Examples var batch = new BatchDnsRecordsRequest( Deletes: [new BatchDeleteOperation("old-record-id")], Posts: [new CreateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "new.example.com", "192.0.2.1")] ); var result = await dns.BatchDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, batch); Console.WriteLine($"Deleted: {result.Deletes?.Count ?? 0}, Created: {result.Posts?.Count ?? 0}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. Default: 1 (automatic). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The newly created CNAME record. Examples var record = await dns.CreateCnameRecordAsync(zoneId, "cdn.example.com", "cdn.provider.com", proxied: true); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId, name, or target is null. ArgumentException Thrown when any required string parameter is empty or whitespace. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The newly created DNS record with its assigned ID. Examples var request = new CreateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.1", Proxied: true); var record = await dns.CreateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, request); Console.WriteLine($"Created record with ID: {record.Id}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. Returns Task A task representing the asynchronous operation. Examples await dns.DeleteDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId); Console.WriteLine("Record deleted successfully."); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or dnsRecordId is null. Returns Task<string> A string containing the zone's records in BIND format. Examples var bindContent = await dns.ExportDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId); await File.WriteAllTextAsync("zone.txt", bindContent); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. Optional: filter by record type to avoid ambiguity when multiple record types exist for the same name. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The matching DNS record, or null if not found. If multiple records match (e.g., both A and AAAA), returns the first one. Examples var record = await dns.FindDnsRecordByNameAsync(zoneId, "www.example.com"); if (record != null) { Console.WriteLine($"Found: {record.Content}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or hostname is null. GetDnsRecordAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Gets a DNS record by its unique identifier. public Task<DnsRecord> GetDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, string dnsRecordId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. dnsRecordId string The DNS record identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Examples var record = await dns.GetDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId); Console.WriteLine($"{record.Name}: {record.Content}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or dnsRecordId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId or dnsRecordId is empty or whitespace. These records are temporary until accepted or rejected via SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, DnsScanReviewRequest, CancellationToken). public Task<IReadOnlyList<DnsRecord>> GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string zoneId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyList<DnsRecord>> List of scanned DNS records pending review. Examples var pending = await dns.GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId); foreach (var record in pending) { Console.WriteLine($"{record.Type} {record.Name} -> {record.Content}"); } Remarks Records expire after 30 days if not reviewed. Use SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, DnsScanReviewRequest, CancellationToken) to accept or reject records. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. Returns Task<DnsImportResult> A result object with a summary of the import operation. Examples var bindContent = await File.ReadAllTextAsync("zone.txt"); var result = await dns.ImportDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, bindContent, proxied: true); Console.WriteLine($"Added: {result.RecordsAdded}, Parsed: {result.TotalRecordsParsed}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or bindContent is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. Pagination options will be managed internally. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<DnsRecord> An asynchronous stream of all matching DNS records. Examples await foreach (var record in dns.ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{record.Name} ({record.Type}): {record.Content}"); } Remarks This method automatically handles pagination by making multiple API requests as needed. The Page and PerPage properties are managed internally and will be ignored if provided. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. Returns Task<PagePaginatedResult<DnsRecord>> A single page of DNS records along with pagination information. Examples // Get first page of A records var result = await dns.ListDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, new ListDnsRecordsFilters(Type: DnsRecordType.A)); foreach (var record in result.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{record.Name}: {record.Content}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/list/ PatchDnsRecordAsync(string, string, PatchDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) Partially updates a DNS record (PATCH). public Task<DnsRecord> PatchDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, string dnsRecordId, PatchDnsRecordRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. dnsRecordId string The DNS record identifier. request PatchDnsRecordRequest The fields to update. Only non-null fields will be changed. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The updated DNS record. Examples // Change only the content var patch = new PatchDnsRecordRequest(Content: "192.0.2.100"); var updated = await dns.PatchDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId, patch); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when any required parameter is null. ArgumentException Thrown when any required string parameter is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/edit/ SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, DnsScanReviewRequest, CancellationToken) Accepts or rejects scanned DNS records. Accepted records become permanent DNS records in the zone. Rejected records are discarded. public Task<DnsScanReviewResult> SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string zoneId, DnsScanReviewRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. request DnsScanReviewRequest The accept/reject decisions. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsScanReviewResult> Counts of accepted and rejected records. Examples // Get pending records from scan review queue var pending = await dns.GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId); // Accept A and AAAA records (pass full record objects), reject others (pass just IDs) var accepts = pending .Where(r => r.Type == DnsRecordType.A || r.Type == DnsRecordType.AAAA) .ToList(); var rejects = pending .Where(r => r.Type != DnsRecordType.A && r.Type != DnsRecordType.AAAA) .Select(r => r.Id) .ToList(); var result = await dns.SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId, new DnsScanReviewRequest { Accepts = accepts, Rejects = rejects }); Console.WriteLine($"Accepted: {result.Accepts}, Rejected: {result.Rejects}"); Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/scan/ TriggerDnsRecordScanAsync(string, CancellationToken) Triggers an asynchronous DNS record scan for the zone. The scan discovers existing DNS records by querying authoritative nameservers. Results are placed in a review queue accessible via GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, CancellationToken). public Task TriggerDnsRecordScanAsync(string zoneId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task representing the asynchronous operation. Examples // Trigger scan await dns.TriggerDnsRecordScanAsync(zoneId); // Wait briefly for initial results (in production, use polling) await Task.Delay(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)); // Get scanned records for review var pending = await dns.GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId); Remarks This operation runs asynchronously. The method returns immediately while the scan continues in the background. Poll GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, CancellationToken) to check for results. Scanned records remain in the review queue for 30 days before automatic expiration. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/scan/ UpdateDnsRecordAsync(string, string, UpdateDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) Fully replaces a DNS record (PUT). public Task<DnsRecord> UpdateDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, string dnsRecordId, UpdateDnsRecordRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. dnsRecordId string The DNS record identifier. request UpdateDnsRecordRequest The complete record data to replace with. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The updated DNS record. Examples var request = new UpdateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.100"); var updated = await dns.UpdateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId, request); Remarks This operation performs a complete replacement. Use PatchDnsRecordAsync(string, string, PatchDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) for partial updates when you only want to change specific fields. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when any required parameter is null. ArgumentException Thrown when any required string parameter is empty or whitespace. api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.IDnsApi.html.title: Interface IDnsApi | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.IDnsApi.html.summary: Interface IDnsApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Dns Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for DNS record operations. All DNS operations are zone-scoped and require a zone ID. This API provides complete CRUD operations for DNS records, including single-record operations, batch operations, and import/export functionality. public interface IDnsApi Examples // Create a DNS record var record = await dns.CreateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, new CreateDnsRecordRequest( DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.1", Proxied: true )); // List all records await foreach (var r in dns.ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{r.Name} ({r.Type}): {r.Content}"); } // Batch operations var batch = new BatchDnsRecordsRequest( Posts: [new CreateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "new.example.com", "192.0.2.2")] ); await dns.BatchDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, batch); Methods BatchDnsRecordsAsync(string, BatchDnsRecordsRequest, CancellationToken) Performs batch DNS record operations in a single API call. Execution Order: Deletes  Patches  Puts  Posts. This order allows you to delete a record and re-create it with the same name in one batch. Task<BatchDnsRecordsResult> BatchDnsRecordsAsync(string zoneId, BatchDnsRecordsRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. request BatchDnsRecordsRequest The batch request containing operations to perform. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<BatchDnsRecordsResult> The result containing the outcome of each operation type. Examples var batch = new BatchDnsRecordsRequest( Deletes: [new BatchDeleteOperation("old-record-id")], Posts: [new CreateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "new.example.com", "192.0.2.1")] ); var result = await dns.BatchDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, batch); Console.WriteLine($"Deleted: {result.Deletes?.Count ?? 0}, Created: {result.Posts?.Count ?? 0}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/batch/ CreateCnameRecordAsync(string, string, string, bool, int, CancellationToken) Creates a CNAME record (convenience method). Task<DnsRecord> CreateCnameRecordAsync(string zoneId, string name, string target, bool proxied = false, int ttl = 1, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. name string The hostname for the CNAME record (e.g., "cdn.example.com"). target string The target hostname the CNAME points to. proxied bool Whether to proxy the record through Cloudflare. ttl int Time to live in seconds. Default: 1 (automatic). cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The newly created CNAME record. Examples var record = await dns.CreateCnameRecordAsync(zoneId, "cdn.example.com", "cdn.provider.com", proxied: true); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId, name, or target is null. ArgumentException Thrown when any required string parameter is empty or whitespace. CreateDnsRecordAsync(string, CreateDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) Creates a new DNS record of any type. Task<DnsRecord> CreateDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, CreateDnsRecordRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. request CreateDnsRecordRequest The DNS record creation request. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The newly created DNS record with its assigned ID. Examples var request = new CreateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.1", Proxied: true); var record = await dns.CreateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, request); Console.WriteLine($"Created record with ID: {record.Id}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/create/ DeleteDnsRecordAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Deletes a DNS record by its ID. Task DeleteDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, string dnsRecordId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. dnsRecordId string The DNS record identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task A task representing the asynchronous operation. Examples await dns.DeleteDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId); Console.WriteLine("Record deleted successfully."); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or dnsRecordId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when any required string parameter is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/delete/ ExportDnsRecordsAsync(string, CancellationToken) Exports DNS records in BIND zone file format. Task<string> ExportDnsRecordsAsync(string zoneId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<string> A string containing the zone's records in BIND format. Examples var bindContent = await dns.ExportDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId); await File.WriteAllTextAsync("zone.txt", bindContent); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/export/ FindDnsRecordByNameAsync(string, string, DnsRecordType?, CancellationToken) Finds a DNS record by its hostname within a zone. Task<DnsRecord?> FindDnsRecordByNameAsync(string zoneId, string hostname, DnsRecordType? type = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. hostname string The fully qualified domain name to search for. type DnsRecordType? Optional: filter by record type to avoid ambiguity when multiple record types exist for the same name. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The matching DNS record, or null if not found. If multiple records match (e.g., both A and AAAA), returns the first one. Examples var record = await dns.FindDnsRecordByNameAsync(zoneId, "www.example.com"); if (record != null) { Console.WriteLine($"Found: {record.Content}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or hostname is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId or hostname is empty or whitespace. GetDnsRecordAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Gets a DNS record by its unique identifier. Task<DnsRecord> GetDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, string dnsRecordId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. dnsRecordId string The DNS record identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The DNS record with all its properties. Examples var record = await dns.GetDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId); Console.WriteLine($"{record.Name}: {record.Content}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or dnsRecordId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId or dnsRecordId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/get/ GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, CancellationToken) Gets DNS records discovered by scanning that are pending review. These records are temporary until accepted or rejected via SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, DnsScanReviewRequest, CancellationToken). Task<IReadOnlyList<DnsRecord>> GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string zoneId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<IReadOnlyList<DnsRecord>> List of scanned DNS records pending review. Examples var pending = await dns.GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId); foreach (var record in pending) { Console.WriteLine($"{record.Type} {record.Name} -> {record.Content}"); } Remarks Records expire after 30 days if not reviewed. Use SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, DnsScanReviewRequest, CancellationToken) to accept or reject records. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/scan/ ImportDnsRecordsAsync(string, string, bool, CancellationToken) Imports DNS records from BIND zone file format. Task<DnsImportResult> ImportDnsRecordsAsync(string zoneId, string bindContent, bool proxied = false, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. bindContent string The BIND zone file content as a string. proxied bool Whether to proxy imported records through Cloudflare. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsImportResult> A result object with a summary of the import operation. Examples var bindContent = await File.ReadAllTextAsync("zone.txt"); var result = await dns.ImportDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, bindContent, proxied: true); Console.WriteLine($"Added: {result.RecordsAdded}, Parsed: {result.TotalRecordsParsed}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or bindContent is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/import/ ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(string, ListDnsRecordsFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all DNS records, automatically handling pagination. IAsyncEnumerable<DnsRecord> ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(string zoneId, ListDnsRecordsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. filters ListDnsRecordsFilters Optional filters for sorting and matching. Pagination options will be managed internally. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<DnsRecord> An asynchronous stream of all matching DNS records. Examples await foreach (var record in dns.ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{record.Name} ({record.Type}): {record.Content}"); } Remarks This method automatically handles pagination by making multiple API requests as needed. The Page and PerPage properties are managed internally and will be ignored if provided. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/list/ ListDnsRecordsAsync(string, ListDnsRecordsFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists DNS records with filtering and pagination support. Task<PagePaginatedResult<DnsRecord>> ListDnsRecordsAsync(string zoneId, ListDnsRecordsFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. filters ListDnsRecordsFilters Optional filters for pagination, sorting, and matching. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<PagePaginatedResult<DnsRecord>> A single page of DNS records along with pagination information. Examples // Get first page of A records var result = await dns.ListDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId, new ListDnsRecordsFilters(Type: DnsRecordType.A)); foreach (var record in result.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{record.Name}: {record.Content}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/list/ PatchDnsRecordAsync(string, string, PatchDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) Partially updates a DNS record (PATCH). Task<DnsRecord> PatchDnsRecordAsync(string zoneId, string dnsRecordId, PatchDnsRecordRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. dnsRecordId string The DNS record identifier. request PatchDnsRecordRequest The fields to update. Only non-null fields will be changed. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsRecord> The updated DNS record. Examples // Change only the content var patch = new PatchDnsRecordRequest(Content: "192.0.2.100"); var updated = await dns.PatchDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId, patch); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when any required parameter is null. ArgumentException Thrown when any required string parameter is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/edit/ SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, DnsScanReviewRequest, CancellationToken) Accepts or rejects scanned DNS records. Accepted records become permanent DNS records in the zone. Rejected records are discarded. Task<DnsScanReviewResult> SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string zoneId, DnsScanReviewRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters zoneId string The zone identifier. request DnsScanReviewRequest The accept/reject decisions. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DnsScanReviewResult> Counts of accepted and rejected records. Examples // Get pending records from scan review queue var pending = await dns.GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId); // Accept A and AAAA records (pass full record objects), reject others (pass just IDs) var accepts = pending .Where(r => r.Type == DnsRecordType.A || r.Type == DnsRecordType.AAAA) .ToList(); var rejects = pending .Where(r => r.Type != DnsRecordType.A && r.Type != DnsRecordType.AAAA) .Select(r => r.Id) .ToList(); var result = await dns.SubmitDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(zoneId, new DnsScanReviewRequest { Accepts = accepts, Rejects = rejects }); Console.WriteLine($"Accepted: {result.Accepts}, Rejected: {result.Rejects}"); Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/scan/ TriggerDnsRecordScanAsync(string, CancellationToken) Triggers an asynchronous DNS record scan for the zone. The scan discovers existing DNS records by querying authoritative nameservers. Results are placed in a review queue accessible via GetDnsRecordScanReviewAsync(string, CancellationToken). Scanned records remain in the review queue for 30 days before automatic expiration. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when zoneId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when zoneId is empty or whitespace. See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/api/resources/dns/subresources/records/methods/scan/ UpdateDnsRecordAsync(string, string, UpdateDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) Fully replaces a DNS record (PUT). Returns Task<DnsRecord> The updated DNS record. Examples var request = new UpdateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.100"); var updated = await dns.UpdateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, recordId, request); Remarks This operation performs a complete replacement. Use PatchDnsRecordAsync(string, string, PatchDnsRecordRequest, CancellationToken) for partial updates when you only want to change specific fields. api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models.DnsRecordT.title: Struct DnsRecordType | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models.DnsRecordT.summary: Struct DnsRecordType Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Represents a DNS record type supported by Cloudflare. DNS record types define the type of data stored in a DNS record, such as IP addresses (A/AAAA), mail servers (MX), or canonical names (CNAME). [JsonConverter(typeof(ExtensibleEnumConverter<DnsRecordType>))] public readonly struct DnsRecordType : IExtensibleEnum<DnsRecordType>, IEquatable<DnsRecordType> Implements IExtensibleEnum<DnsRecordType> IEquatable<DnsRecordType> Inherited Members object.Equals(object, object) object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Examples // Using a known record type with IntelliSense var type = DnsRecordType.CNAME; // Creating a DNS record request var request = new CreateDnsRecordRequest(DnsRecordType.A, "example.com", "192.0.2.1", 3600, true); // Using implicit conversion from string DnsRecordType customType = "NEW_RECORD_TYPE"; Remarks This is an extensible enum that provides IntelliSense for known values while allowing custom values for new record types that may be added to the Cloudflare API in the future. Use the static properties for known record types (e.g., A, CNAME) or create custom values using the constructor or implicit string conversion. Constructors DnsRecordType(string) Creates a new DnsRecordType with the specified value. public DnsRecordType(string value) Parameters value string The string value representing the record type. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when value is null. Properties A A record - maps a hostname to an IPv4 address. public static DnsRecordType A { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks The most common DNS record type for pointing domains to servers. AAAA AAAA record - maps a hostname to an IPv6 address. public static DnsRecordType AAAA { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks The IPv6 equivalent of an A record. CAA CAA record - specifies which Certificate Authorities can issue certificates. public static DnsRecordType CAA { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Helps prevent unauthorized certificate issuance. CERT CERT record - stores certificates in DNS. public static DnsRecordType CERT { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Can store various types of certificates including X.509 and PGP. CNAME CNAME record - creates an alias from one hostname to another. public static DnsRecordType CNAME { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Useful for pointing subdomains to other domains or services. DNSKEY DNSKEY record - contains the public key for DNSSEC. public static DnsRecordType DNSKEY { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Used by resolvers to verify DNSSEC signatures. DS DS record - Delegation Signer record for DNSSEC. public static DnsRecordType DS { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Used to establish chains of trust in DNSSEC. HTTPS HTTPS record - provides connection information for HTTPS services. public static DnsRecordType HTTPS { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Enables clients to learn about HTTPS alternative services. MX MX record - specifies mail servers for the domain. public static DnsRecordType MX { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Used to route email to the correct mail servers. NAPTR NAPTR record - naming authority pointer for URI resolution. public static DnsRecordType NAPTR { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Used in ENUM and SIP applications. NS NS record - specifies authoritative nameservers for the domain. public static DnsRecordType NS { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Delegates DNS resolution to specific nameservers. PTR PTR record - maps an IP address to a hostname (reverse DNS). public static DnsRecordType PTR { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Used for reverse DNS lookups. SMIMEA SMIMEA record - S/MIME certificate association. public static DnsRecordType SMIMEA { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Associates S/MIME certificates with email addresses. SOA SOA record - contains administrative information about the zone. public static DnsRecordType SOA { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Every DNS zone must have exactly one SOA record. SRV SRV record - specifies a host and port for specific services. public static DnsRecordType SRV { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Used for services like VoIP, instant messaging, and other protocols. SSHFP SSHFP record - SSH public key fingerprint. public static DnsRecordType SSHFP { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Allows SSH clients to verify server host keys via DNS. SVCB SVCB record - general service binding record. public static DnsRecordType SVCB { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks The generic version of HTTPS records for other protocols. TLSA TLSA record - DANE certificate association. public static DnsRecordType TLSA { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Associates TLS server certificates with domain names. TXT TXT record - holds arbitrary text data. public static DnsRecordType TXT { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Remarks Commonly used for domain verification, SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records. URI URI record - publishes mappings from hostnames to URIs. public static DnsRecordType URI { get; } Property Value DnsRecordType Value Gets the underlying string value of this record type. public string Value { get; } Property Value string Methods Create(string) Creates a new instance of the extensible enum from the specified string value. public static DnsRecordType Create(string value) Parameters value string The string value to wrap. Returns DnsRecordType A new instance of DnsRecordType containing the specified value. Equals(DnsRecordType) Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type. public bool Equals(DnsRecordType other) Parameters other DnsRecordType An object to compare with this object. Returns bool true if the current object is equal to the other parameter; otherwise, false. Equals(object?) Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal. public override bool Equals(object? obj) Parameters obj object The object to compare with the current instance. Returns bool true if obj and this instance are the same type and represent the same value; otherwise, false. GetHashCode() Returns the hash code for this instance. public override int GetHashCode() Returns int A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance. ToString() Returns the fully qualified type name of this instance. public override string ToString() Returns string The fully qualified type name.
