Returns DnsRecordType operator !=(DnsRecordType, DnsRecordType) Determines whether two DnsRecordType values are not equal. public static bool operator !=(DnsRecordType left, DnsRecordType right) Parameters left DnsRecordType right DnsRecordType Returns bool See Also https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/manage-dns-records/reference/dns-record-types/

api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Dns.Models Classes BatchDeleteOperation Delete operation for batch - references a record by its ID. BatchDnsRecordsRequest Request to perform batch DNS record operations in a single API call. Execution Order: Deletes  Patches  Puts  Posts. This order ensures that deletions happen first, allowing re-creation of records with the same name in the same batch. BatchDnsRecordsResult Result of a batch DNS records operation. Contains the results of each operation type. Each array contains the resulting DNS records (for creates/updates) or the deleted records (for deletes). BatchPatchOperation Patch operation for batch - includes record ID and fields to update. Only the fields you include will be updated; other fields retain their values. BatchPutOperation Put operation for batch - includes record ID and all fields for full replacement. This performs a complete replacement of the record. All required fields must be provided. CreateDnsRecordRequest Request to create a new DNS record. Supports all record types and optional features like comments and tags. For MX and SRV records, the Priority field is required. DnsImportResult Represents the result of a bulk DNS record import operation. DnsRecord Represents a complete DNS record from the Cloudflare API. This model includes all properties returned by the API, including optional fields like comments, tags, meta information, and record-specific settings. DnsRecordMeta Additional metadata for a DNS record. Contains information about how the record was created and its source. DnsRecordSettings Optional settings for DNS records. These settings control advanced DNS behavior like IPv4/IPv6-only resolution. DnsScanAcceptItem A DNS record object for accepting scanned DNS records. The Cloudflare API requires full DNS record objects (including the Id field) when accepting scanned records. This type provides proper JSON serialization with appropriate ignore conditions for optional fields. DnsScanReviewRequest Request to accept or reject scanned DNS records. Accepted records become permanent DNS records in the zone. Rejected records are discarded from the review queue. DnsScanReviewResult Result of a DNS scan review operation indicating how many records were processed. ListDnsRecordsFilters Defines the filtering and pagination options for listing DNS records. PatchDnsRecordRequest Request to partially update a DNS record (PATCH). All fields are optional; only include fields you want to change. Unspecified fields retain their current values. UpdateDnsRecordRequest Request to fully replace a DNS record (PUT). All required fields must be provided. This performs a complete replacement of the record at the specified ID. Structs DnsRecordType Represents a DNS record type supported by Cloudflare. DNS record types define the type of data stored in a DNS record, such as IP addresses (A/AAAA), mail servers (MX), or canonical names (CNAME).

api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Dns | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Dns.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Dns Classes DnsApi Implements the API for managing DNS records in Cloudflare zones. Interfaces IDnsApi Defines the contract for DNS record operations. All DNS operations are zone-scoped and require a zone ID. This API provides complete CRUD operations for DNS records, including single-record operations, batch operations, and import/export functionality.

api/Cloudflare.NET.ICloudflareApiClient..title: Interface ICloudflareApiClient | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.ICloudflareApiClient..summary: Interface ICloudflareApiClient Namespace Cloudflare.NET Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Defines the contract for the primary client for interacting with the Cloudflare API. This client acts as a facade, providing access to different API resource areas such as Accounts, User, and Zones. public interface ICloudflareApiClient : IDisposable Inherited Members IDisposable.Dispose() Remarks This is the main entry point for the SDK. It should be registered with a dependency injection container as a transient service using the AddCloudflareApiClient() extension method. Inject this interface into your services to access all Cloudflare APIs: public class MyService(ICloudflareApiClient cf) { public async Task DoSomething() { var zones = await cf.Zones.ListZonesAsync(); var user = await cf.User.GetUserAsync(); // ... } } Properties Accounts Gets the API resource for managing Account-level resources. This includes R2 buckets, account-wide IP Access Rules, and account-level WAF custom rulesets. IAccountsApi Accounts { get; } Property Value IAccountsApi ApiTokens Gets the API resource for managing API tokens. API tokens provide fine-grained access control for Cloudflare API operations. Each token has policies that define what resources and actions are allowed. IApiTokensApi ApiTokens { get; } Property Value IApiTokensApi Examples // Create a new token var result = await cf.ApiTokens.CreateAccountTokenAsync(accountId, new CreateApiTokenRequest( Name: "CI/CD Token", Policies: new[] { new CreateTokenPolicyRequest( Effect: "allow", PermissionGroups: new[] { new TokenPermissionGroupReference(permGroupId) }, Resources: new Dictionary<string, string> { ["com.cloudflare.api.account.*"] = "*" }) })); Console.WriteLine($"Token: {result.Value}"); // Store securely! AuditLogs Gets the API resource for accessing audit logs. Audit logs provide a record of actions taken on account resources, useful for security monitoring, compliance, and troubleshooting. Logs are retained for 30 days. IAuditLogsApi AuditLogs { get; } Property Value IAuditLogsApi Examples // Get recent audit logs var logs = await cf.AuditLogs.GetAccountAuditLogsAsync(accountId, new ListAuditLogsFilters(Since: DateTime.UtcNow.AddDays(-7))); foreach (var log in logs.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{log.Action.Time}: {log.Action.Type} by {log.Actor.Email}"); } Dns Gets the API resource for managing DNS records. Provides complete CRUD operations for DNS records, including batch operations, import/export functionality, and searching by hostname. IDnsApi Dns { get; } Property Value IDnsApi Examples // Create a DNS record var record = await cf.Dns.CreateDnsRecordAsync(zoneId, new CreateDnsRecordRequest( DnsRecordType.A, "www.example.com", "192.0.2.1" )); // List all DNS records await foreach (var r in cf.Dns.ListAllDnsRecordsAsync(zoneId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{r.Name}: {r.Content}"); } Members Gets the API resource for managing account members. Account members are users who have been granted access to a Cloudflare account. Members are assigned roles that determine their permissions within the account. IMembersApi Members { get; } Property Value IMembersApi Examples // List all account members await foreach (var member in cf.Members.ListAllAccountMembersAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{member.User.Email}: {member.Status}"); foreach (var role in member.Roles) Console.WriteLine($" - {role.Name}"); } // Invite a new member var newMember = await cf.Members.CreateAccountMemberAsync(accountId, new CreateAccountMemberRequest( Email: "newuser@example.com", Roles: new[] { adminRoleId }, Status: MemberStatus.Pending)); Roles Gets the API resource for managing account roles. Roles are predefined by Cloudflare and define sets of permissions that can be assigned to account members. This API is read-only. IRolesApi Roles { get; } Property Value IRolesApi Examples // List all available roles await foreach (var role in cf.Roles.ListAllAccountRolesAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Name}: {role.Description}"); if (role.Permissions.Dns?.Write == true) Console.WriteLine(" - Can modify DNS"); } Subscriptions Gets the API resource for managing subscriptions. Subscriptions manage billing plans and add-ons for Cloudflare services. This API provides access to account-level subscription management. ISubscriptionsApi Subscriptions { get; } Property Value ISubscriptionsApi Examples // List account subscriptions var subscriptions = await cf.Subscriptions.ListAccountSubscriptionsAsync(accountId); foreach (var sub in subscriptions) { Console.WriteLine($"{sub.RatePlan?.PublicName}: {sub.State}"); Console.WriteLine($" Price: {sub.Price} {sub.Currency}/{sub.Frequency}"); } // Create a new subscription var newSub = await cf.Subscriptions.CreateAccountSubscriptionAsync(accountId, new CreateAccountSubscriptionRequest( RatePlan: new RatePlanReference("rate_plan_id"), Frequency: SubscriptionFrequency.Monthly)); Remarks Billing Permissions Required: Requires tokens with Billing Read/Write permissions. Cost Warning: Creating or updating subscriptions may incur charges. Turnstile Gets the API resource for managing Turnstile widgets. Turnstile is Cloudflare's CAPTCHA alternative that provides bot protection without user friction. Widgets are account-scoped resources. ITurnstileApi Turnstile { get; } Property Value ITurnstileApi Examples // Create a Turnstile widget var widget = await cf.Turnstile.CreateWidgetAsync(accountId, new CreateTurnstileWidgetRequest( Name: "Contact Form", Domains: new[] { "example.com" }, Mode: WidgetMode.Managed)); // IMPORTANT: Store the secret securely - it won't be available again! Console.WriteLine($"Sitekey: {widget.Sitekey}"); Console.WriteLine($"Secret: {widget.Secret}"); // Later, rotate the secret var result = await cf.Turnstile.RotateSecretAsync(accountId, widget.Sitekey); Console.WriteLine($"New secret: {result.Secret}"); Remarks Important: Widget secrets are only returned on creation and rotation. Store them securely as they cannot be retrieved again. User Gets the API resource for managing the authenticated user's profile. This includes retrieving and editing the current user's personal information, such as name, country, and contact details. IUserApi User { get; } Property Value IUserApi Workers Gets the API resource for managing Worker routes. Worker routes map URL patterns to Worker scripts, determining which requests are handled by which Workers. Routes are zone-scoped resources. IWorkersApi Workers { get; } Property Value IWorkersApi Examples // List all Worker routes in a zone var routes = await cf.Workers.ListRoutesAsync(zoneId); foreach (var route in routes) { Console.WriteLine($"{route.Pattern} -> {route.Script ?? "(disabled)"}"); } // Create a new route var newRoute = await cf.Workers.CreateRouteAsync(zoneId, new CreateWorkerRouteRequest( Pattern: "api.example.com/*", Script: "api-handler")); Zones Gets the API resource for managing Zone-level resources. This includes DNS records, zone-specific IP Access Rules, WAF configurations, and other settings scoped to a specific zone. IZonesApi Zones { get; } Property Value IZonesApi

api/Cloudflare.NET.Members.IMembersApi.h.title: Interface IMembersApi | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Members.IMembersApi.h.summary: Interface IMembersApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Members Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Provides access to Cloudflare Account Members API. Account members are users who have been granted access to an account's resources. This API allows inviting new members, managing their roles, and removing access. public interface IMembersApi Examples // List all members await foreach (var member in client.Members.ListAllAccountMembersAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{member.User.Email} - {member.Status}"); } // Invite a new member var request = new CreateAccountMemberRequest( Email: "newuser@example.com", Roles: new[] { roleId } ); var newMember = await client.Members.CreateAccountMemberAsync(accountId, request); Remarks When a new member is invited, they receive an email and must accept the invitation to gain access. Members can have multiple roles that define their permissions. Important: Modifying or removing members may have security implications. Ensure you have proper authorization before making changes. Methods CreateAccountMemberAsync(string, CreateAccountMemberRequest, CancellationToken) Invites a new member to the account. An invitation email will be sent to the specified email address. The user must accept the invitation to become an active member. Task<AccountMember> CreateAccountMemberAsync(string accountId, CreateAccountMemberRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. request CreateAccountMemberRequest The invitation details including email and roles. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<AccountMember> The created member (with status "pending" until accepted). Examples var request = new CreateAccountMemberRequest( Email: "developer@example.com", Roles: new[] { dnsAdminRoleId } ); var member = await client.Members.CreateAccountMemberAsync(accountId, request); Console.WriteLine($"Invited {member.User.Email}, status: {member.Status}"); Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. The email address must not already be associated with an existing member. At least one role must be specified. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId or request is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. DeleteAccountMemberAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Removes a member from the account. The user will immediately lose access to the account's resources. This action cannot be undone - the user must be re-invited to regain access. Task<DeleteAccountMemberResult> DeleteAccountMemberAsync(string accountId, string memberId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. memberId string The membership identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<DeleteAccountMemberResult> Result containing the deleted membership ID. Examples var result = await client.Members.DeleteAccountMemberAsync(accountId, memberId); Console.WriteLine($"Removed member: {result.Id}"); Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. Warning: You cannot remove yourself from an account. Attempting to do so will result in an error. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId or memberId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId or memberId is empty or whitespace. HttpRequestException Thrown when the member is not found (HTTP 404). GetAccountMemberAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Gets details for a specific account member. Task<AccountMember> GetAccountMemberAsync(string accountId, string memberId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. memberId string The membership identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<AccountMember> The member details including user info and roles. Examples var member = await client.Members.GetAccountMemberAsync(accountId, memberId); Console.WriteLine($"Member: {member.User.Email}"); Console.WriteLine($"Status: {member.Status}"); Console.WriteLine($"Roles: {string.Join(", ", member.Roles.Select(r => r.Name))}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId or memberId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId or memberId is empty or whitespace. HttpRequestException Thrown when the member is not found (HTTP 404). ListAccountMembersAsync(string, ListAccountMembersFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all members of an account. Returns paginated results of account members with their status and roles. Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountMember>> ListAccountMembersAsync(string accountId, ListAccountMembersFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountMembersFilters Optional filtering and pagination options. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountMember>> A page of account members. Examples var members = await client.Members.ListAccountMembersAsync(accountId, new ListAccountMembersFilters(Status: MemberStatus.Accepted)); foreach (var member in members.Items) Console.WriteLine($"{member.User.Email}: {member.Status}"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. ListAllAccountMembersAsync(string, ListAccountMembersFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all members of an account, automatically handling pagination. IAsyncEnumerable<AccountMember> ListAllAccountMembersAsync(string accountId, ListAccountMembersFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountMembersFilters Optional filtering options. Pagination parameters are ignored. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<AccountMember> An async enumerable of all account members. Examples // Iterate through all members without manual pagination await foreach (var member in client.Members.ListAllAccountMembersAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{member.User.Email}: {string.Join(", ", member.Roles.Select(r => r.Name))}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. UpdateAccountMemberAsync(string, string, UpdateAccountMemberRequest, CancellationToken) Updates an existing account member's roles. Only the roles assigned to the member can be updated. The user's email and status cannot be changed. Task<AccountMember> UpdateAccountMemberAsync(string accountId, string memberId, UpdateAccountMemberRequest request, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. memberId string The membership identifier. request UpdateAccountMemberRequest The updated member details. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<AccountMember> The updated member. Examples var request = new UpdateAccountMemberRequest( Roles: new[] { viewerRoleId, dnsAdminRoleId } ); var updated = await client.Members.UpdateAccountMemberAsync(accountId, memberId, request); Remarks Preview: This operation has limited test coverage. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when any parameter is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId or memberId is empty or whitespace. HttpRequestException Thrown when the member is not found (HTTP 404).

Returns paginated results of account members with their status and roles. public Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountMember>> ListAccountMembersAsync(string accountId, ListAccountMembersFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountMembersFilters Optional filtering and pagination options. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. ListAllAccountMembersAsync(string, ListAccountMembersFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all members of an account, automatically handling pagination. public IAsyncEnumerable<AccountMember> ListAllAccountMembersAsync(string accountId, ListAccountMembersFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountMembersFilters Optional filtering options. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. UpdateAccountMemberAsync(string, string, UpdateAccountMemberRequest, CancellationToken) Updates an existing account member's roles. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when any parameter is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId or memberId is empty or whitespace. HttpRequestException Thrown when the member is not found (HTTP 404).

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration.R2Se.title: Class R2Settings | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration.R2Se.summary: Class R2Settings Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Represents R2-specific settings for the S3-compatible API, typically loaded from configuration. public class R2Settings Inheritance object R2Settings Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Fields DefaultRegion The default R2 region. Cloudflare R2 uses "auto" as the region for all operations. public const string DefaultRegion = "auto" Field Value string Properties AccessKeyId The R2 Access Key ID (from user secrets or environment variables). Required. public string AccessKeyId { get; set; } Property Value string EndpointUrl The R2 S3 API endpoint URL. When set, must contain a format placeholder {0} for the Account ID. public string? EndpointUrl { get; set; } Property Value string Remarks When null or empty (the default), the endpoint is automatically computed from Jurisdiction: Default: https://{account_id}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com EU: https://{account_id}.eu.r2.cloudflarestorage.com FedRAMP: https://{account_id}.fedramp.r2.cloudflarestorage.com When explicitly set, this value takes precedence over Jurisdiction. This allows for custom endpoint configurations or testing scenarios. Jurisdiction The jurisdiction for this R2 client configuration. Determines which S3 endpoint to use when EndpointUrl is not explicitly set. public R2Jurisdiction Jurisdiction { get; set; } Property Value R2Jurisdiction Examples Configuration via appsettings.json: { "R2": { "AccessKeyId": "...", "SecretAccessKey": "...", "Jurisdiction": "eu" } } Remarks Defaults to Default (no jurisdictional restriction), which uses the global endpoint: https://{account_id}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com When set to a specific jurisdiction (e.g., EuropeanUnion), the S3 endpoint URL is automatically computed to use the jurisdiction-specific endpoint. If EndpointUrl is explicitly set, it takes precedence over the jurisdiction-based endpoint calculation. Region The R2 region. Defaults to "auto", which is the standard region for Cloudflare R2. public string Region { get; set; } Property Value string SecretAccessKey The R2 Secret Access Key (from user secrets or environment variables). Required. public string SecretAccessKey { get; set; } Property Value string Methods GetEffectiveEndpointUrl(string) Gets the effective endpoint URL for this configuration, computing from jurisdiction if not explicitly set. public string GetEffectiveEndpointUrl(string accountId) Parameters accountId string The Cloudflare account ID to substitute into the endpoint URL. Returns string The fully-formed S3 endpoint URL ready for use with the AWS SDK. Remarks Resolution order: If EndpointUrl is set, use it with {0} replaced by account ID. Otherwise, compute from Jurisdiction using GetS3EndpointUrl(string). Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is null or whitespace. GetEndpointUrlForJurisdiction(string, R2Jurisdiction) Gets the endpoint URL for a specific jurisdiction override, ignoring EndpointUrl. public static string GetEndpointUrlForJurisdiction(string accountId, R2Jurisdiction jurisdictionOverride) Parameters accountId string The Cloudflare account ID. jurisdictionOverride R2Jurisdiction The jurisdiction to use instead of Jurisdiction. Returns string The fully-formed S3 endpoint URL for the specified jurisdiction. Remarks This method always computes the endpoint from the jurisdiction parameter, ignoring both EndpointUrl and Jurisdiction. Used by IR2ClientFactory when creating jurisdiction-specific clients with GetClient(R2Jurisdiction) or GetClient(string, R2Jurisdiction). Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is null or whitespace.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration.R2Se.title: Class R2SettingsValidator | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration.R2Se.summary: Class R2SettingsValidator Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Validates R2Settings to ensure all required configuration is present and valid. This validator is invoked at startup when using ValidateOnStart(), providing immediate feedback for configuration issues rather than waiting for the first API call to fail. public class R2SettingsValidator : IValidateOptions<R2Settings> Inheritance object R2SettingsValidator Implements IValidateOptions<R2Settings> Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This validator checks that the R2 S3 credentials (AccessKeyId and SecretAccessKey) are provided. It also validates that the EndpointUrl, if customized, contains the required '{0}' placeholder for the Account ID. The validation errors are designed to be clear and actionable, mentioning "Cloudflare R2" explicitly so developers can quickly identify the source of configuration issues. For validation of CloudflareApiOptions (AccountId), use CloudflareApiOptionsValidator with ForR2. When registered as IValidateOptions<TOptions>, this validator skips named options by default. The R2ClientFactory should use ValidateConfiguration(string?, R2Settings) directly for explicit validation with CloudflareR2ConfigurationException. Constructors R2SettingsValidator() Initializes a new instance of the R2SettingsValidator class with default skip behavior for named options. public R2SettingsValidator() R2SettingsValidator(bool) Initializes a new instance of the R2SettingsValidator class with explicit skip behavior control. public R2SettingsValidator(bool skipNamedOptions) Parameters skipNamedOptions bool If true, the validator returns Skip for named options (non-default names). Set to false when performing explicit validation in the factory. Methods Validate(string?, R2Settings) Validates a specific named options instance (or all when name is null). public ValidateOptionsResult Validate(string? name, R2Settings options) Parameters name string The name of the options instance being validated. options R2Settings The options instance. Returns ValidateOptionsResult The ValidateOptionsResult result. ValidateConfiguration(string?, R2Settings) Validates the specified R2Settings and returns a result with error messages. This method is intended for use by the R2ClientFactory to perform explicit validation with proper error messages that include the client name. public static ValidateOptionsResult ValidateConfiguration(string? name, R2Settings options) Parameters name string The options name. For named clients, this should be the client name to include in error messages. For default clients, pass null or DefaultName. options R2Settings The R2 settings to validate. Returns ValidateOptionsResult A ValidateOptionsResult indicating success or failure with error messages.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2.Configuration Classes R2Settings Represents R2-specific settings for the S3-compatible API, typically loaded from configuration. R2SettingsValidator Validates R2Settings to ensure all required configuration is present and valid. This validator is invoked at startup when using ValidateOnStart(), providing immediate feedback for configuration issues rather than waiting for the first API call to fail.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.IR2Client.html.title: Interface IR2Client | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.IR2Client.html.summary: Interface IR2Client Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2 Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Defines the contract for a client that interacts with Cloudflare R2's S3-compatible API, with robust error handling and metric reporting. public interface IR2Client Methods AbortMultipartUploadAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) Aborts a multipart upload, deleting any parts that have already been uploaded. This is a free operation. Task<R2Result> AbortMultipartUploadAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string uploadId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key of the object. uploadId string The ID of the multipart upload to abort. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the abort operation (should be zero). Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the operation fails. ClearBucketAsync(string, bool, CancellationToken) Clears all objects from an R2 bucket by repeatedly listing and deleting them in batches. Task<R2Result> ClearBucketAsync(string bucketName, bool continueOnError = true, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket to clear. continueOnError bool If true, the operation will continue even if some delete batches fail. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the total metrics of all list and delete operations. Exceptions CloudflareR2BatchException<T> Thrown if some objects could not be deleted. CloudflareR2ListException<T> Thrown if listing objects fails. CompleteMultipartUploadAsync(string, string, string, IEnumerable<PartETag>, CancellationToken) Completes a multipart upload after all parts are uploaded. Task<R2Result> CompleteMultipartUploadAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string uploadId, IEnumerable<PartETag> parts, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key of the object. uploadId string The ID of the multipart upload. parts IEnumerable<PartETag> A list of the part numbers and their corresponding ETags. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the finalization operation. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the operation fails. CreatePresignedPutUrl(string, PresignedPutRequest) Creates a presigned PUT URL that allows for uploading a file directly to R2, enforcing constraints via signed headers. string CreatePresignedPutUrl(string bucketName, PresignedPutRequest request) Parameters bucketName string The name of the bucket where the upload will occur. request PresignedPutRequest A request object defining the key and headers to enforce. Returns string A string containing the generated presigned URL. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if URL generation fails. CreatePresignedUploadPartUrl(string, PresignedUploadPartRequest) Creates a presigned URL for uploading a single part of a multipart upload. string CreatePresignedUploadPartUrl(string bucketName, PresignedUploadPartRequest request) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. request PresignedUploadPartRequest The parameters for the presigned part URL. Returns string A string containing the generated presigned URL for the part. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if URL generation fails. CreatePresignedUploadPartsUrls(string, PresignedUploadPartsRequest) Creates a batch of presigned URLs for uploading multiple parts of a multipart upload. IReadOnlyDictionary<int, string> CreatePresignedUploadPartsUrls(string bucketName, PresignedUploadPartsRequest request) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. request PresignedUploadPartsRequest The parameters for the presigned part URLs. Returns IReadOnlyDictionary<int, string> A dictionary mapping each part number to its generated presigned URL. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if URL generation fails for any part. DeleteObjectAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Deletes a single object from an R2 bucket. This is a free operation. Task<R2Result> DeleteObjectAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key of the object to delete. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the delete operation (should be zero). Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the delete fails. DeleteObjectsAsync(string, IEnumerable<string>, bool, CancellationToken) Deletes multiple objects from an R2 bucket in batches. This is a free operation. Task<R2Result> DeleteObjectsAsync(string bucketName, IEnumerable<string> objectKeys, bool continueOnError = true, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKeys IEnumerable<string> An enumeration of object keys to delete. continueOnError bool If true, the operation will continue even if some batches fail, throwing an exception only at the end. If false, it will stop on the first error. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the total metrics of all attempted operations (should be zero). Exceptions CloudflareR2BatchException<T> Thrown if one or more objects could not be deleted. Contains a list of the failed keys. DownloadFileAsync(string, string, Stream, CancellationToken) Downloads a file from an R2 bucket to a stream. Task<R2Result> DownloadFileAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, Stream outputStream, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key of the object to download. outputStream Stream The stream to write the downloaded data to. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics, including egress bytes. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the download fails. DownloadFileAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) Downloads a file from an R2 bucket to a local file path. Task<R2Result> DownloadFileAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string downloadPath, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key of the object to download. downloadPath string The local path to save the downloaded file to. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics, including egress bytes. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the download fails. InitiateMultipartUploadAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Initiates a new multipart upload. Task<R2Result<string>> InitiateMultipartUploadAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key for the object in the bucket. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result<string>> A result object containing the UploadId and operation metrics. Exceptions CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the operation fails. ListObjectsAsync(string, string?, CancellationToken) Lists all objects in an R2 bucket, optionally filtered by a prefix, handling pagination automatically. Task<R2Result<IReadOnlyList<S3Object>>> ListObjectsAsync(string bucketName, string? prefix, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. prefix string The prefix to filter the object listing by. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result<IReadOnlyList<S3Object>>> A result object containing a read-only list of all S3Object items found and aggregated metrics. Exceptions CloudflareR2ListException<T> Thrown if listing fails mid-stream, containing any objects fetched successfully. ListPartsAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) Lists the parts that have been uploaded for a specific multipart upload, transparently handling pagination. Task<R2Result<IReadOnlyList<ListedPart>>> ListPartsAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string uploadId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key of the object. uploadId string The ID of the multipart upload. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result<IReadOnlyList<ListedPart>>> A result object containing the full list of parts and the aggregated metrics. Exceptions CloudflareR2ListException<T> Thrown if listing fails mid-stream, containing any parts fetched successfully. UploadAsync(string, string, Stream, long?, CancellationToken) Uploads a file from a stream, automatically choosing between a single PUT request or a multipart upload. If the stream is seekable, the choice is based on its length. If it is not seekable, it will always attempt a multipart upload. Task<R2Result> UploadAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, Stream fileStream, long? partSize = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. fileStream Stream The stream to upload. partSize long? The desired size in bytes for each part in a multipart upload. If null, a sensible default is used. The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the stream is seekable and its length exceeds R2's 5 TiB limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the upload fails. NotSupportedException Thrown if a multipart upload is attempted but the stream is not seekable. UploadAsync(string, string, string, long?, CancellationToken) Uploads a file from a local path, automatically choosing between a single PUT request or a multipart upload based on the file size. Task<R2Result> UploadAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string filePath, long? partSize = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. filePath string The path to the local file to upload. partSize long? The desired size in bytes for each part in a multipart upload. If null, a sensible default is used. The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the file size exceeds R2's 5 TiB limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the upload fails. FileNotFoundException Thrown if the specified filePath does not exist. UploadMultipartAsync(string, string, Stream, long?, CancellationToken) Uploads a file from a stream using a multipart upload. The stream must be seekable. This method provides direct control over multipart uploads. Task<R2Result> UploadMultipartAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, Stream inputStream, long? partSize = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. inputStream Stream The stream to upload. Must be seekable. partSize long? The desired size in bytes for each part. If null, a sensible default is used. The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the aggregate metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the stream length exceeds R2's 5 TiB limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if any part of the upload fails. NotSupportedException Thrown if the provided stream is not seekable. UploadMultipartAsync(string, string, string, long?, CancellationToken) Uploads a file using a multipart upload. This method provides direct control over multipart uploads. Task<R2Result> UploadMultipartAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string filePath, long? partSize = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. filePath string The path to the local file to upload. partSize long? The desired size in bytes for each part. If null, a sensible default is used. The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the aggregate metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the file size exceeds R2's 5 TiB limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if any part of the upload fails. UploadSinglePartAsync(string, string, Stream, CancellationToken) Uploads a file from a stream using a single PUT request. This method provides direct control and should be used when the automatic selection in UploadAsync(string, string, Stream, long?, CancellationToken) is not desired. Task<R2Result> UploadSinglePartAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, Stream inputStream, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. inputStream Stream The stream to upload. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the stream is seekable and its length exceeds the 5 GiB single-part upload limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the upload fails. UploadSinglePartAsync(string, string, string, CancellationToken) Uploads a file using a single PUT request. This method provides direct control and should be used when the automatic selection in UploadAsync(string, string, string, long?, CancellationToken) is not desired. Task<R2Result> UploadSinglePartAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, string filePath, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. filePath string The path to the local file to upload. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the file size exceeds the 5 GiB single-part upload limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the upload fails.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.IR2ClientFactory.h.title: Interface IR2ClientFactory | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.IR2ClientFactory.h.summary: Interface IR2ClientFactory Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2 Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Defines the contract for a factory that creates and caches IR2Client instances. Supports named configurations for multi-account scenarios and jurisdiction-specific clients for accessing buckets in different geographic regions. public interface IR2ClientFactory Examples // Single account, multiple jurisdictions var defaultClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.Default); var euClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); // Multiple accounts var prodClient = factory.GetClient("production"); var stagingClient = factory.GetClient("staging"); // Multiple accounts with jurisdiction override var prodEuClient = factory.GetClient("production", R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); Remarks All clients created by this factory are cached and reused. The AWS S3 client is thread-safe and designed to be used as a singleton, so caching improves performance by avoiding repeated client construction. Cache Keys: GetClient(name) - Cached by (name, configured-jurisdiction) GetClient(jurisdiction) - Cached by ("", jurisdiction) GetClient(name, jurisdiction) - Cached by (name, jurisdiction) Methods GetClient(R2Jurisdiction) Gets an IR2Client for the specified jurisdiction using the default (unnamed) credentials. IR2Client GetClient(R2Jurisdiction jurisdiction) Parameters jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction The target jurisdiction for R2 operations. Returns IR2Client A cached IR2Client instance configured for the specified jurisdiction. Examples // Access buckets in different jurisdictions with the same credentials var globalClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.Default); var euClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); var fedRampClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.FedRamp); // Upload to EU-jurisdictional bucket await euClient.UploadAsync("my-eu-bucket", "file.txt", stream); Remarks This method uses the credentials from the default (unnamed) R2 configuration registered via AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, Action<R2Settings>) . The same R2 credentials work across all jurisdictions within an account; only the S3 endpoint differs. Clients are cached by jurisdiction and reused for subsequent calls. Exceptions CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the default R2 configuration is missing or invalid. GetClient(string) Gets or creates a named IR2Client instance configured with the specified named options. IR2Client GetClient(string name) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration to use. Must match the name used during registration with AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, string, Action<R2Settings>) . Returns IR2Client A cached IR2Client instance configured with the named options. Examples // Registration services.AddCloudflareR2Client("primary", options => { options.AccessKeyId = "primary-key"; options.SecretAccessKey = "primary-secret"; }); services.AddCloudflareR2Client("backup", options => { options.AccessKeyId = "backup-key"; options.SecretAccessKey = "backup-secret"; }); // Usage via factory public class MyService(IR2ClientFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var primaryClient = factory.GetClient("primary"); var backupClient = factory.GetClient("backup"); // ... } } Remarks The client uses the jurisdiction specified in the named configuration's Jurisdiction. To access a different jurisdiction with the same credentials, use GetClient(string, R2Jurisdiction). Clients are cached by (name, configured-jurisdiction) and reused for subsequent calls. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the named configuration is missing or invalid. GetClient(string, R2Jurisdiction) Gets an IR2Client for the specified jurisdiction using named credentials. IR2Client GetClient(string name, R2Jurisdiction jurisdiction) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration providing credentials. Must match the name used during registration. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction The target jurisdiction for R2 operations. Returns IR2Client A cached IR2Client instance configured with the named credentials and specified jurisdiction. Examples // Production account has buckets in both default and EU jurisdictions var prodDefault = factory.GetClient("production", R2Jurisdiction.Default); var prodEu = factory.GetClient("production", R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); // DR account uses FedRAMP jurisdiction var drFedRamp = factory.GetClient("disaster-recovery", R2Jurisdiction.FedRamp); Remarks Use this method when you have multiple accounts (each with different credentials) and need to access buckets in specific jurisdictions within those accounts. Clients are cached by (name, jurisdiction) tuple and reused for subsequent calls. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the named configuration is missing or invalid.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.Models.PresignedPo.summary: Class PresignedPostRequest Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2.Models Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Defines the parameters for creating a presigned POST URL for browser-based uploads. public record PresignedPostRequest : IEquatable<PresignedPostRequest> Inheritance object PresignedPostRequest Implements IEquatable<PresignedPostRequest> Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors PresignedPostRequest(string, TimeSpan, string?, (long Min, long Max)?, IEnumerable<S3PostCondition>?, IReadOnlyDictionary<string, string>?) ContentLengthRange = null, IEnumerable<S3PostCondition>? Conditions = null, IReadOnlyDictionary<string, string>? HeadersToSign = null) Parameters Key string The object key (path) where the file will be stored in the bucket. ExpiresAfter TimeSpan The duration for which the presigned URL will be valid. ContentType string An optional but recommended condition to enforce the MIME type of the uploaded file (e.g., "image/jpeg"). ContentLengthRange (long Min, long Max)? An optional but recommended condition to enforce the minimum and maximum size of the uploaded file in bytes. Conditions { get; init; } Property Value IEnumerable<S3PostCondition> ContentLengthRange An optional but recommended condition to enforce the minimum and maximum size of the uploaded file in bytes. public (long Min, long Max)? DeleteObjectAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Deletes a single object from an R2 bucket. UploadAsync(string, string, Stream, long?, CancellationToken) Uploads a file from a stream, automatically choosing between a single PUT request or a multipart upload. If the stream is seekable, the choice is based on its length. If it is not seekable, it will always attempt a multipart upload. public Task<R2Result> UploadAsync(string bucketName, string objectKey, Stream fileStream, long? partSize = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters bucketName string The name of the target bucket. objectKey string The key (path) for the object in the bucket. fileStream Stream The stream to upload. partSize long? The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the file size exceeds R2's 5 TiB limit. CloudflareR2OperationException Thrown if the upload fails. Must be seekable. partSize long? The desired size in bytes for each part. If null, a sensible default is used. The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the aggregate metrics of the operation. NotSupportedException Thrown if the provided stream is not seekable. UploadMultipartAsync(string, string, string, long?, CancellationToken) Uploads a file using a multipart upload. The desired size in bytes for each part. If null, a sensible default is used. The value is clamped between 5MiB and 5GiB. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<R2Result> An R2Result detailing the aggregate metrics of the operation. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the file size exceeds R2's 5 TiB limit. api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.R2ClientFactory.ht.title: Class R2ClientFactory | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.R2ClientFactory.ht.summary: Class R2ClientFactory Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2 Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Factory that creates and caches IR2Client instances. Supports named configurations for multi-account scenarios and jurisdiction-specific clients for accessing buckets in different geographic regions. public sealed class R2ClientFactory : IR2ClientFactory, IDisposable Inheritance object R2ClientFactory Implements IR2ClientFactory IDisposable Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This factory caches created clients to leverage the thread-safe, singleton-friendly nature of the AWS S3 client. Clients are cached by a composite key of (name, jurisdiction). Named clients are registered using AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, string, Action<R2Settings>) . Constructors R2ClientFactory(IOptionsMonitor<R2Settings>, IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions>, ILoggerFactory) Initializes a new instance of the R2ClientFactory class. public R2ClientFactory(IOptionsMonitor<R2Settings> r2OptionsMonitor, IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions> cloudflareOptionsMonitor, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory) Parameters r2OptionsMonitor IOptionsMonitor<R2Settings> The options monitor for named R2 settings. cloudflareOptionsMonitor IOptionsMonitor<CloudflareApiOptions> The options monitor for named Cloudflare API options. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory The logger factory. Methods Dispose() Disposes all cached R2 clients and their underlying S3 clients. public void Dispose() GetClient(R2Jurisdiction) Gets an IR2Client for the specified jurisdiction using the default (unnamed) credentials. public IR2Client GetClient(R2Jurisdiction jurisdiction) Parameters jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction The target jurisdiction for R2 operations. Returns IR2Client A cached IR2Client instance configured for the specified jurisdiction. Examples // Access buckets in different jurisdictions with the same credentials var globalClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.Default); var euClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); var fedRampClient = factory.GetClient(R2Jurisdiction.FedRamp); // Upload to EU-jurisdictional bucket await euClient.UploadAsync("my-eu-bucket", "file.txt", stream); Remarks This method uses the credentials from the default (unnamed) R2 configuration registered via AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, Action<R2Settings>) . The same R2 credentials work across all jurisdictions within an account; only the S3 endpoint differs. Clients are cached by jurisdiction and reused for subsequent calls. Exceptions CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the default R2 configuration is missing or invalid. GetClient(string) Gets or creates a named IR2Client instance configured with the specified named options. public IR2Client GetClient(string name) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration to use. Must match the name used during registration with AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, string, Action<R2Settings>) . Returns IR2Client A cached IR2Client instance configured with the named options. Examples // Registration services.AddCloudflareR2Client("primary", options => { options.AccessKeyId = "primary-key"; options.SecretAccessKey = "primary-secret"; }); services.AddCloudflareR2Client("backup", options => { options.AccessKeyId = "backup-key"; options.SecretAccessKey = "backup-secret"; }); // Usage via factory public class MyService(IR2ClientFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var primaryClient = factory.GetClient("primary"); var backupClient = factory.GetClient("backup"); // ... } } Remarks The client uses the jurisdiction specified in the named configuration's Jurisdiction. To access a different jurisdiction with the same credentials, use GetClient(string, R2Jurisdiction). Clients are cached by (name, configured-jurisdiction) and reused for subsequent calls. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the named configuration is missing or invalid. GetClient(string, R2Jurisdiction) Gets an IR2Client for the specified jurisdiction using named credentials. public IR2Client GetClient(string name, R2Jurisdiction jurisdiction) Parameters name string The name of the client configuration providing credentials. Must match the name used during registration. jurisdiction R2Jurisdiction The target jurisdiction for R2 operations. Returns IR2Client A cached IR2Client instance configured with the named credentials and specified jurisdiction. Examples // Production account has buckets in both default and EU jurisdictions var prodDefault = factory.GetClient("production", R2Jurisdiction.Default); var prodEu = factory.GetClient("production", R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion); // DR account uses FedRAMP jurisdiction var drFedRamp = factory.GetClient("disaster-recovery", R2Jurisdiction.FedRamp); Remarks Use this method when you have multiple accounts (each with different credentials) and need to access buckets in specific jurisdictions within those accounts. Clients are cached by (name, jurisdiction) tuple and reused for subsequent calls. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the named configuration is missing or invalid.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.ServiceCollectionE.title: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.ServiceCollectionE.summary: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2 Assembly Cloudflare.NET.R2.dll Provides extension methods for setting up the Cloudflare R2 client in an IServiceCollection. public static class ServiceCollectionExtensions Inheritance object ServiceCollectionExtensions Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, IConfiguration) Registers the IR2Client and its dependencies using a configuration section. This is a convenience method that binds to the "R2" section of the application's IConfiguration. It also requires the "Cloudflare" section for the Account ID. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareR2Client(this IServiceCollection services, IConfiguration configuration) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. configuration IConfiguration The application configuration, used to bind R2 settings. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, Action<R2Settings>) Registers the IR2Client and its dependencies, allowing for fine-grained programmatic configuration. This method sets up the underlying S3-compatible client tailored for R2 and registers the high-level IR2Client as a singleton. Configuration is validated at application startup. If required settings (AccessKeyId, SecretAccessKey, AccountId) are missing, an OptionsValidationException is thrown with a clear error message indicating what configuration is missing and how to fix it. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareR2Client(this IServiceCollection services, Action<R2Settings> configureOptions) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. configureOptions Action<R2Settings> An action to configure the R2Settings. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Exceptions OptionsValidationException Thrown at application startup if required configuration is missing or invalid. AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, string, IConfiguration) Registers a named IR2Client configuration using a configuration section. Named clients can be retrieved using IR2ClientFactory or via keyed services using [FromKeyedServices("name")]. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareR2Client(this IServiceCollection services, string name, IConfiguration configuration) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. name string The unique name for this client configuration. Used to retrieve the client from the factory or via keyed services. configuration IConfiguration The application configuration. Will bind to the "R2:" section for R2 settings and "Cloudflare:" section for the Account ID. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. AddCloudflareR2Client(IServiceCollection, string, Action<R2Settings>) Registers a named IR2Client configuration with programmatic options. Named clients can be retrieved using IR2ClientFactory or via keyed services using [FromKeyedServices("name")]. public static IServiceCollection AddCloudflareR2Client(this IServiceCollection services, string name, Action<R2Settings> configureOptions) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add the services to. name string The unique name for this client configuration. Used to retrieve the client from the factory or via keyed services. configureOptions Action<R2Settings> An action to configure the R2Settings. Returns IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection so that additional calls can be chained. Examples // Register multiple named clients services.AddCloudflareApiClient("primary", options => { options.AccountId = "primary-account-id"; options.ApiToken = "primary-token"; }); services.AddCloudflareR2Client("primary", options => { options.AccessKeyId = "primary-key"; options.SecretAccessKey = "primary-secret"; // Jurisdiction defaults to R2Jurisdiction.Default (global endpoint) // Set options.Jurisdiction = R2Jurisdiction.EuropeanUnion for EU buckets }); // Use via factory public class MyService(IR2ClientFactory factory) { public async Task DoSomething() { var primaryClient = factory.CreateClient("primary"); // ... } } // Or use via keyed services public class MyService([FromKeyedServices("primary")] IR2Client client) { // ... } Remarks This method requires that the Cloudflare API options for the same name are also registered using AddCloudflareApiClient(IServiceCollection, string, Action<CloudflareApiOptions>) . The Account ID from those options is used to construct the R2 endpoint URL. Unlike the default client registration, named clients are validated when first created via the factory or keyed services, not at application startup. This is because named configurations may be dynamically added or configured after startup. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when name is null or whitespace. CloudflareR2ConfigurationException Thrown when the named client is created if required configuration is missing or invalid.

api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2 | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.R2.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.R2 Classes R2Client Implements the client that interacts with Cloudflare R2's S3-compatible API. R2ClientFactory Factory that creates and caches IR2Client instances. Supports named configurations for multi-account scenarios and jurisdiction-specific clients for accessing buckets in different geographic regions. ServiceCollectionExtensions Provides extension methods for setting up the Cloudflare R2 client in an IServiceCollection. Interfaces IR2Client Defines the contract for a client that interacts with Cloudflare R2's S3-compatible API, with robust error handling and metric reporting. IR2ClientFactory Defines the contract for a factory that creates and caches IR2Client instances. Supports named configurations for multi-account scenarios and jurisdiction-specific clients for accessing buckets in different geographic regions.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Roles.IRolesApi.html.title: Interface IRolesApi | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Roles.IRolesApi.html.summary: Interface IRolesApi Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Roles Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Provides access to Cloudflare Account Roles API. Roles are predefined by Cloudflare and define sets of permissions that can be assigned to account members. This API is read-only; roles cannot be created, modified, or deleted via the API. public interface IRolesApi Examples // List all available roles await foreach (var role in client.Roles.ListAllAccountRolesAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Name}: {role.Description}"); // Check specific permissions if (role.Permissions.Dns?.Write == true) Console.WriteLine(" - Can modify DNS"); } Remarks Common roles include "Administrator", "Administrator Read Only", "DNS Administrator", "Audit Log Viewer", and "Billing". Actual available roles depend on account type and plan. Role IDs from this API are used when assigning roles to account members via the IMembersApi. Methods GetAccountRoleAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Gets details for a specific role. Task<AccountRole> GetAccountRoleAsync(string accountId, string roleId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. roleId string The role identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<AccountRole> The role details including permissions. Examples var role = await client.Roles.GetAccountRoleAsync(accountId, roleId); Console.WriteLine($"Role: {role.Name}"); Console.WriteLine($"Description: {role.Description}"); // Check DNS permissions if (role.Permissions.DnsRecords is { Read: true, Write: true }) Console.WriteLine("Has full DNS access"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId or roleId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId or roleId is empty or whitespace. HttpRequestException Thrown when the role is not found (HTTP 404). ListAccountRolesAsync(string, ListAccountRolesFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all roles available in the account. Roles are predefined by Cloudflare and define sets of permissions that can be assigned to account members. Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountRole>> ListAccountRolesAsync(string accountId, ListAccountRolesFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountRolesFilters Optional pagination options. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountRole>> A page of account roles. Examples var roles = await client.Roles.ListAccountRolesAsync(accountId); foreach (var role in roles.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Name}: {role.Description}"); if (role.Permissions.Dns?.Write == true) Console.WriteLine(" - Can modify DNS"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. ListAllAccountRolesAsync(string, ListAccountRolesFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all roles available in the account, automatically handling pagination. IAsyncEnumerable<AccountRole> ListAllAccountRolesAsync(string accountId, ListAccountRolesFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountRolesFilters Optional pagination options. Pagination parameters are ignored. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<AccountRole> An async enumerable of all account roles. Examples // Iterate through all roles without manual pagination await foreach (var role in client.Roles.ListAllAccountRolesAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Id}: {role.Name}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace.

Methods GetAccountRoleAsync(string, string, CancellationToken) Gets details for a specific role. public Task<AccountRole> GetAccountRoleAsync(string accountId, string roleId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. roleId string The role identifier. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<AccountRole> The role details including permissions. Examples var role = await client.Roles.GetAccountRoleAsync(accountId, roleId); Console.WriteLine($"Role: {role.Name}"); Console.WriteLine($"Description: {role.Description}"); // Check DNS permissions if (role.Permissions.DnsRecords is { Read: true, Write: true }) Console.WriteLine("Has full DNS access"); Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId or roleId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId or roleId is empty or whitespace. HttpRequestException Thrown when the role is not found (HTTP 404). ListAccountRolesAsync(string, ListAccountRolesFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all roles available in the account. Roles are predefined by Cloudflare and define sets of permissions that can be assigned to account members. public Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountRole>> ListAccountRolesAsync(string accountId, ListAccountRolesFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountRolesFilters Optional pagination options. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns Task<PagePaginatedResult<AccountRole>> A page of account roles. Examples var roles = await client.Roles.ListAccountRolesAsync(accountId); foreach (var role in roles.Items) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Name}: {role.Description}"); if (role.Permissions.Dns?.Write == true) Console.WriteLine(" - Can modify DNS"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace. ListAllAccountRolesAsync(string, ListAccountRolesFilters?, CancellationToken) Lists all roles available in the account, automatically handling pagination. public IAsyncEnumerable<AccountRole> ListAllAccountRolesAsync(string accountId, ListAccountRolesFilters? filters = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters accountId string The account identifier. filters ListAccountRolesFilters Optional pagination options. Pagination parameters are ignored. cancellationToken CancellationToken A cancellation token. Returns IAsyncEnumerable<AccountRole> An async enumerable of all account roles. Examples // Iterate through all roles without manual pagination await foreach (var role in client.Roles.ListAllAccountRolesAsync(accountId)) { Console.WriteLine($"{role.Id}: {role.Name}"); } Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when accountId is null. ArgumentException Thrown when accountId is empty or whitespace.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Roles.html.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Roles | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Roles.html.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Roles Classes RoleConstants Constants for Cloudflare account roles. These are the standard role names returned by the Cloudflare API. Role availability varies by account type and subscription plan. RolesApi Implementation of IRolesApi for Cloudflare Account Roles. Provides read-only access to predefined Cloudflare roles that define sets of permissions for account members. Interfaces IRolesApi Provides access to Cloudflare Account Roles API. Roles are predefined by Cloudflare and define sets of permissions that can be assigned to account members. This API is read-only; roles cannot be created, modified, or deleted via the API.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Security.Firewall.Mod.summary: Struct AccessRuleMode Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Security.Firewall.Models Assembly Cloudflare.NET.dll Represents the action to take for an IP Access Rule. Access rule modes define the behavior when a request matches the rule's configuration. Options range from blocking to allowing, with various challenge types in between. [JsonConverter(typeof(ExtensibleEnumConverter<AccessRuleMode>))] public readonly struct AccessRuleMode : IExtensibleEnum<AccessRuleMode>, IEquatable<AccessRuleMode> Implements IExtensibleEnum<AccessRuleMode> IEquatable<AccessRuleMode> Inherited Members object.Equals(object, object) object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Examples // Using a known mode with IntelliSense var mode = AccessRuleMode.Block; // Using implicit conversion from string AccessRuleMode customMode = "new-mode"; // Comparison if (rule.Mode == AccessRuleMode.Whitelist) { ... } Remarks This is an extensible enum that provides IntelliSense for known values while allowing custom values for new modes that may be added to the Cloudflare API in the future. Use the static properties for known modes (e.g., Block, Challenge) or create custom values using the constructor or implicit string conversion. Constructors AccessRuleMode(string) Creates a new AccessRuleMode with the specified value. public AccessRuleMode(string value) Parameters value string The string value representing the mode. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when value is null. Properties Block Block action - denies access to matching requests. public static AccessRuleMode Block { get; } Property Value AccessRuleMode Remarks Prevents a visitor from visiting your site. Returns a 403 Forbidden status code. Challenge Interactive Challenge action - presents a challenge page to the visitor. public static AccessRuleMode Challenge { get; } Property Value AccessRuleMode Remarks Requires the visitor to complete an interactive challenge before visiting your site. Prevents bots from accessing the site. JsChallenge JavaScript Challenge action - presents an Under Attack mode interstitial page. public static AccessRuleMode JsChallenge { get; } Property Value AccessRuleMode Remarks The visitor or client must support JavaScript. The challenge is automatically satisfied by browsers but blocks most bots. Useful for blocking DDoS attacks with minimal impact to legitimate visitors. ManagedChallenge Managed Challenge action - dynamically chooses the appropriate challenge type. public static AccessRuleMode ManagedChallenge { get; } Property Value AccessRuleMode Remarks Cloudflare will dynamically choose the appropriate type of challenge based on the characteristics of a request. This helps reduce the time humans spend solving CAPTCHAs while maintaining security. Value Gets the underlying string value of this mode. public string Value { get; } Property Value string Whitelist Whitelist (Allow) action - excludes visitors from all security checks. public static AccessRuleMode Whitelist { get; } Property Value AccessRuleMode Remarks Excludes visitors from all security checks, including Browser Integrity Check, Under Attack mode, and the WAF. Use this option when a trusted visitor is being blocked by Cloudflare's default security features. The Allow action takes precedence over the Block action. api/Cloudflare.NET.Security.Firewall.Mod.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Security.Firewall.Models Classes AccessRule Represents a single IP Access Rule. AccessRuleConfiguration Represents the abstract configuration for an access rule, defining what to match against. AccessRuleConfigurationConverter Custom JSON converter for deserializing the polymorphic AccessRuleConfiguration. AsnConfiguration An access rule configuration that targets an Autonomous System Number (ASN). CidrConfiguration An access rule configuration that targets an IP range in CIDR notation. CountryConfiguration An access rule configuration that targets a two-letter country code. CreateAccessRuleRequest Defines the request payload for creating a new IP Access Rule. CreateLockdownRequest Defines the request payload for creating a new Zone Lockdown rule. CreateUaRuleRequest Defines the request payload for creating a new User-Agent blocking rule. GenericConfiguration A generic access rule configuration for unknown or future target types. IpConfiguration An access rule configuration that targets a single IPv4 or IPv6 address. ListAccessRulesFilters Defines the filtering and pagination options for listing IP Access Rules. ListLockdownFilters Defines the pagination options for listing Zone Lockdown rules. ListUaRulesFilters Defines the pagination options for listing User-Agent Blocking rules. Lockdown Represents a Zone Lockdown rule returned by the Cloudflare API. LockdownConfiguration Represents a single IP configuration within a Zone Lockdown rule. Scope Represents the scope of an access rule. UaRule Represents a User-Agent blocking rule returned by the Cloudflare API. UaRuleConfiguration Represents the configuration for a User-Agent blocking rule. UpdateAccessRuleRequest Defines the request payload for updating an existing IP Access Rule. All properties are optional. UpdateLockdownRequest Defines the request payload for updating a Zone Lockdown rule. UpdateUaRuleRequest Defines the request payload for updating a User-Agent blocking rule. Structs AccessRuleMode Represents the action to take for an IP Access Rule. Access rule modes define the behavior when a request matches the rule's configuration. Options range from blocking to allowing, with various challenge types in between. AccessRuleTarget Represents the target type for an IP Access Rule's configuration. Access rule targets define what type of network entity the rule applies to, such as a single IP address, IP range, ASN, or country. LockdownTarget Represents the target type for a Zone Lockdown rule's configuration. Zone Lockdown targets define what type of IP entity the rule applies to, such as a single IP address or IP range. UaRuleMode Represents the action to take for a User-Agent blocking rule. User-Agent blocking modes define what happens when a request's User-Agent header matches the rule's configured pattern. Enums AccessRuleOrderField Defines the fields by which IP Access Rules can be ordered. FilterMatch Defines how multiple filters are combined when listing resources. ListOrderDirection Defines the direction for sorting lists.

api/Cloudflare.NET.Security.Rulesets.Mod.title: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Security.Rulesets.Models | Cloudflare.NET
api/Cloudflare.NET.Security.Rulesets.Mod.summary: Namespace Cloudflare.NET.Security.Rulesets.Models Classes ActionParametersWithResponse A generic container for action parameters that include a custom response. CategoryOverride An override for a category of rules within a managed ruleset. CreateRuleRequest Defines the request payload for creating a new rule within a ruleset. CreateRulesetRequest Defines the request payload for creating a new ruleset. ExecuteOverrides Defines overrides for a managed or custom ruleset being executed. ExecuteParameters Action parameters for an 'execute' rule, used to deploy another ruleset, such as a Managed WAF Ruleset. This is primarily used to add a rule to the entrypoint of the http_request_firewall_managed phase to enable a Cloudflare-provided or a custom ruleset. ListRulesetVersionsFilters Defines the pagination options for listing Ruleset versions. ListRulesetsFilters Defines the pagination options for listing Rulesets. Logging Defines logging configuration for a rule. RateLimitParameters Defines the configuration for a rate limiting rule. Response Defines a custom HTTP response for a rule action. Rule Represents a single rule within a Ruleset. RuleOverride An override for a specific rule within an executed ruleset. Ruleset Represents a Cloudflare Ruleset. SkipParameters Action parameters for a 'skip' rule, used to create exceptions. UpdateRulesetRequest Defines the request payload for updating an existing ruleset. Structs ManagedWafOverrideAction Represents an action that can be used when overriding rules in a Managed WAF Ruleset. Override actions allow you to customize the behavior of individual rules or categories within a managed ruleset without modifying the ruleset itself. RulesetAction Represents an action that can be performed by a rule in the Cloudflare Ruleset Engine. Actions define what happens when a rule's expression matches an incoming request. Different actions are available depending on the ruleset phase being configured.
